- after a long night at Skylark or Double Dutch, or even the tranny bar I have to pass when walking from Bart to these places
- when I'm a hot mess, drunk, and lonely
- when I'm hungry... period
- when I have visitors in town and they want to see what SF nightlife is like... screw El Farolito, this is where it's at!
- to kill time when the next 14 bus comes in half an hour
... and other uninteresting (but justified) reasons.

I very much like visiting the dude who parks under the Roxie sign. He's cool, and he doesn't judge me when I tell him I don't want anything but onions on my hot dog. I like to enjoy the salty, greasy goodness that is this hot dog, and the carmelized onions are pretty much the icing on this greasy cake. There's someone else who charges more than four bucks, but I'd rather not talk about them. 

Also, sidenote: bacon wrapped hot dogs are available around 6pm when walking away from the CCSF campus. 24th street I believe. 

Due to my drinking habits, I also used to think I imagined this cart once it hit 2am. Although I will say, walking along Mission street at night is probably the hardest thing my fat self has ever done. It's littered with these guys... at least where I walk.
author: Caroline L.

description: Whoever wrote that it's the best food to eat when your drunk is right. It's worth every penny and more (I give the girl a ten dollar tip for a two dollar hot dog.)
author: Jayne N.

description:
OMG

I have heard the legends of this.... I have only lived in S.F. since October 2008 and have STILL heard about bacon wrapped hot dog.

Well, I tried it tonight. 12:30 am, outside of the Cat Club.

I very very rarely ever eat meat, but HOLY SHIT. BACON + HOT DOG + MUSTARD + KETCHUP = INSTANT ORGASM.

Yes.
author: Courtney S.

description:
Oh, bacon-wrapped hot dogs...you seduce me with your irresistible smell, just begging me to eat you.  AND YOU ARE DELICIOUS.

While the bacon-wrapped hot dog is a genius idea, the grilled onions just put you over the edge.  NOM NOM NOM.  Fresh and hot off the grill, this bun-full of meaty goodness is the drunk partygoer's jackpot.

As mouth watering as these are, I couldn't give it 5 stars because you never quite know where to find them.  There's one consistently by Bruno's (but you have to battle a long line most of the time, which is the worst when you're drunk and want to inhale that dog RIGHT NOW).  That being said, if someone has these dog carts mapped out and doesn't mind sharing, he or she will be my new favorite person.

Also, what's up with the arbitrary prices?  I've seen them sold from $3-5 over the past MONTH.  Granted it's only $1 or $2, but hey, we're in a recession here, and you can't help but feel a little jipped when you've paid $5 one night, and $3 the next DAY.  

As much as I bitch about the arbitrary locations and prices, you can bet that I'll be back for more...
author: Alice C.

description:
New York... 
San Diego... 
Boston... 
San Francisco...

Are you listening?

Good.

BACON. DOG. CART. SUCKS.

It's legendary, I know, and I'll probably get shot in the street for even thinking otherwise. But, it needs to be said. Someone needs to stand up for the silent minority. 

How the hell did this get first place on Yelp?!

I'd eat peanuts off the bathroom floor if drunk enough, but I still wouldn't give it five stars.

The bacon is soggy, the bread is greasy (and also soggy), and everything tastes like condiments. Tell me... How does one overpower one of the most densely flavored concoctions (bacon) known to man?! You really have to fuck something up.

And they use the same tongs for EVERYTHING.

Yes, I'll give it an additional star for being $3, but there are better things to spend your money on:

-A slice of Arinell's pizza.
-PAM cooking spray.
-Unwanted Beanie Babies.
-1/5 of a blowjob from a hooker on Capp St.
-and (if you use your imagination) Unicorn Savings Bonds.

Why doesn't anyone else see it?!

I feel like I'm taking crazy pills!!
author: Keane L.

description:
It appears, as we turn the corner, like an apparition out of nowhere. I look to my friends...

Me: Is this it?
L: Yes.  Yes it is!
Me: The famed "Bacon Dog Cart"? but I thought it was just a myth!

Apparently the Cart only appears at night to those who believe in it... and have quaffed a magical elixir called "All-Ko-Haul".

Lauren scoots in front of me to grab one of these delicious bacon-wrapped meat wands. I believe it took her only 2 bites to finish the poor thing off.

There's this nagging sensation I can't get rid of as I await my beautiful wiener to be slavered in condiment goodness.

Me: Lauren, aren't you Jewish?
L: *nods head* Yes 100%!
Me: I might not be a rabbi, but isn't that verboten?!?
L: I DON'T CARE! I HAD TO HAVE ONE! WANT MORE!!!!! *wild-eyed crazy eyes at my hot dog*

That's why it gets 5 stars. It's TRUE the Cart can make a JEW break a TABOO! (That rhyming FOO'? Why it's me, that's WHO!) I'm not religious, but that's some serious shit right? Doesn't she get thrown out of Valhalla or something like that?

EDIT: I've been informed that Valhalla isn't Jewish, I guess that must be the Christian one. The Judaic version is where after they cast the One Ring into the Crack of Doom and then sail off into the Undying Lands... right?
author: Jason K.

description:
Fugging finally!!!

I had my very first Bacon Dog and most definitely not my last after an entire year of trying to find this legend of drunkeny goodness that I'd been reading about on yelp.

It was in front of 111 Minna towards the end of the night in my state of a drunken stupor when all of the sudden I see this infamous Bacon Dog Cart across the ally. My eyes opened wide, my jaw dropped and my heart started pounding faster, kind of like when I got to touch "girly parts" for the very 1st time as a youth.

I rushed over and ordered one STAT!!! I don't remember what the first one tasted like because I woofed it down in 3 bites, so I ended up ordering a second one and took my sweet time, savoring each and every bite. 

I then asked Mr Bacon Dog Cart guy if he had a business card so I could stalk him. He didn't have any cards on him so he opted to give me his cell phone number instead. I then thought to myself, should I wait 2 days before calling him so I don't come off too desperate or aggressive?

The next morning I woke up only to forget all about the experience until today. I was flipping though the numbers in my phone and found an entry for "Bacon Dog Cart guy", hence this review written two weeks late.

Sober, it might only get 3 or 4 stars but for late night drunken munchies, you really can't go wrong.

I love you Bacon Cart Guy! Will you be my sexless lifetime partner?

UPDATE  03/01/08:
I know that I'm no Takeru Kobayashi or Joey Chestnut, but I had 3 Bacon Dogs last night doused with Jalapeno Peppers. So Good!!!
author: Thömas F.

description:
It's my first Yelp-iversary (if there's such a thing to celebrate), and I can't think of a better way to commemorate this occasion than with a bacon-wrapped hot dog. New York's got San Francisco beat for street food, but if they ever started selling bacon-wrapped hot dogs in the Big Apple, it could cause a great disruption in NYC's street food ecosystem.

Like most good food, there's nothing pretentious about the bacon-wrapped hot dog. It's just good, simple, honest food (tm Gordon Ramsay). It's a hot dog, wrapped in bacon and served on a bun with grilled onions and your choice of toppings (ketchup, mustard, mayo, jalapenos). 

It's perfect for post-club, post-boozing, or in my case, post-Rock the Bells eating. During rage against the machine's set, Zack de la Rocha told me that I had the power to make a positive change in the world.

So after I was done with my bacon dog, I used my newly discovered power to order a second one. He was right...the second dog made me less hungry and even more satisfied than before.

I'd call that positive change! :-)
author: Arnold G.

description: While it doesn't take any great feat to make a hot dog with bacon around it and some grilled onions and mayo, the bacon hot dog cart guy is always there for you.
author: Mike L.

description:
The bacon dog is like a stripper looking for lap dances. Easier on the eyes once you've had a few.

Sexy, scandalous goodies peaking through tightly wrapped rolls of bacon (just go with it...) and begging to be devoured. Her tempting aroma grabs your attention from across the way, beckoning you to give her a try.

You stroll over and casually ask, "How much?"

"Three dollars." Reasonable. You do the deal.

You bite. She's good, but it's not what you expected. Intoxicated, you're not thinking about just this dirty deed, but all the others before. Bite.  She's so good going down. Bite.

And then the song's over. And you're wanting more, but the magic's gone, and all that's left is a greasy aftertaste and junk all over your hands.

And then you're off, feeling dirty, unfulfilled, wanting more than ever before, looking for the real thing... but not tonight my love, not tonight...
author: Perci N.

description:
There's a reason I only eat these when I'm trashed.  Yes, I've had my own religious moments with these dogs.  But do any of us actually remember what they taste like?  

I'm just sayin'.
author: Nicole G.

description:
OH, BACON DOG CART, WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE?
*my friend and I came across sed bacon dog cart outside the cat club on 9th and folsom in the SOMA district, but it was so extraordinary, i must yelp it*

it was fate, i tell ya. super yelper mel v. wanted 2 things : 1) a cigarette and 2) to dance to some really cheesy current radio hits. we exited cat club and tried to scam our way into icon. EPIC FAIL. however, this then became a great moment, because she spoted THE BACON DOG CART.

There they were, grilling up, wrapped in bacon, caressed by a pile of onions, ready to be devoured by the masses. its everything you think i t will be and more. the buns are perfect, the bacon-covered hot dog divine, the grilled onions sheer perfection----then she adds mayo mustard, ketchup, jalapenos---if you want---, and you are on your way to sweetfunkyflavortown!! we gobbled up these savory treats, and headed back into cat club. when our other friend realized we had had bacon dogs and failed to bring him one, we were chastised severely.
author: Caddy M.

description:
I would punch Jesus in the nuts for one of these bacon wrapped works of art.  Lucky for him he wasn't working this cart last Friday night.

What I really want to know is why can the bacon wrapped hot dog that made TJ such a magical place to visit as a kid make it's way up north of LA but carne asada fries, burritos with grilled flour tortillas, and decent tacos de adobada can't?
author: Luis M.

description:
I have two sides. The one who loves dive bars, taquerias, camping and a good bargain. Then there is the part of me that likes lounges, fancy restaurants with good food, 5 star hotels and Saks 5th Ave. I think having a combo of both keeps you balanced. 

In college, when I was underage and could only afford the former we spent an awful lot of time in Tijuana, drinking on the cheap and bringing home ugly panchos and ceramic statues of anything iconic in pop culture 5 years prior. We were young and drunk, we did dumb things. One of those things was eating bacon wrapped hot dogs South of the border. Lets just say, though I am unsure whether it was the copious amounts of booze or the actual food, I never wanted another one of these things as long as I lived after my first experience. 

Enter all of my friends in SF, many years later, who swear by these things. So, finally I tried one. I did not get horribly sick, and by that I mean I did not throw up, and it was actually decent for drunk food. I wonder if it would have been as good if I weren't drunk and hungry. I wonder if any of my friends who are die hard fans have had these while sober. And, though it did the trick, I would still rather have a nice dinner at Farallon. Don't hate.
author: Drue C.

description:
Anyone that's done some solid boozing in the Mission has probably ran across a couple of these carts.  They might be a little tough to spot from the road, but if you're walking down the street they are impossible to miss.

You can smell the carts half a block away, as they are busy grilling up onions to be used as fixings for your bacon dog.  They also had a jar of mild jalapenos on hand if you liked a bit of extra flavor on your dog.  

The dogs set us back 3 bucks each and I much prefer them to the tamales that Tamale Lady was selling.  Sometimes you just crave something fatty and greasy after a lot of drinks.

My only regret was that although the bacon dog hit me like a brick, I wasn't quite satisfied.  I'm pretty sure it was too small for my ravenous appetite that late at night.  Unfortunately we still do not have Roberto's in SF or the North bay, so my ideal drunk food (Carne Asada chips and guacamole) will have to wait.
author: Eric L.

description:
Now if you know me, you know I love hot juicy meat in my mouth.  

There are moments when I ache for it.  I crave it. I search it out when I get the need. There is no fighting the urge for a hot juicy piece of meat.  

Honestly...when I want it I must have it.  It better be good, too.  Nothing is more disappointing to this girl than having sub-par piece of meat in my mouth.  

Bacon Dog...I should've never let you in.
author: Jay H.

description:
I'm not a believer in God, but when I was hungry and a little inebriated after drinks at nearby Delirium, this place was a God send. I had one of these scrumptious niblets and the tasty, juicy, greasy goodness filled my stomach, heart and soul. It was just what I needed.   

All praise the bacon-wrapped hot dog cart.
author: Robin K.

description:
Okay, I thumbed my nose at the Bacon Dog Cart and said-- "Eeeew gross, hot dogs are gross and these are wrapped in bacon with mayonnaise on them - yuk, that's just disgusting! Plus they're being served outside on a stinky street corner reeking of stale beer and cigarettes."

Then I took a reluctant bite of my BF's during the cab ride home and wished to God I had my own.
author: wendella a.

description:
If anyone considers this good, you must be reTARDed!

Do you know what's in a bacon dog? Loads of fat, grease, and *. 

Yes, *, you don't know what your eating. Studies have shown large consumptions of bacon hot dog to gain weight, lose sex appeal, and even Fecal Incontinence. So next time, you see one, please have four!

Nutrition Facts

   Saturated Fat  5g 75%

Calcium 2%

Fat 78.0%     Carbs 8.0%
Protein 13.3%

author: Stanley K.

description:
Bacon wrapped hot dogs with onions sauteed in the bacon drippings. Yum! A little too greasy for me tho. I am glad I didn't have to drink all over the Mission to find the bacon dog cart and finally experience this wonderful creation. 

Caveat: 20 minutes earlier I ate at Pakwan, also known for oily. 3 hours prior, I ate a Polish dog at Gestalt Haus, also oily. 

Although I was full, I had to experience the bacon dog first hand. It's kinda like when you lost your virginity. No matter how much pr0n you watched; no matter how much you rubbed it out, nothing could prepare you for that first time. You didn't come close. 

Hopefully yours was good. Mine was... And this time it only cost $3!
author: Kevo M.

description:
Stumbling down Mission.  A vision.  A faint figure.  Is that  Christ?  No.  Even more incredible.  More spiritual.  It's the Bacon Dog Cart!

I honestly can't think of anything that is a more welcome sight when your drunk, hungry, and stumbling home.  Well, maybe a few things.  But those are too graphic to talk about here.

I think this is one of those 'only in America' foods.  I mean really no one can top this.  Oh, wait.  I forgot.  Us Americans always strive for bigger.  Better.  Fatter.  http://www.nytimes.com/2009/01/28/dining/28bacon.html?_r=1
author: Justin B.

description:
I don't like to toot my own horn here, but I consider myself a bit of an International Street Meat Connoisseur. Drop me in a foreign country, and within 24 hours, you'll find me standing in front a bustling street cart, blissfully gnawing on something very meaty and very very delicious.

Lessee...

Donor kebab at 2am outside a Brighton club
Chicken sate served off a makeshift grill in Bali
Baozi from Shanghai street carts
Spicy merguez in a Tangiers bazaar
Tian bu la and takoyaki in a Taipei Street Market
Fish tacos off a roadside stand in Baja
Grilled snails from a pushcart along the Yangtze River
Skewered frogs (yes, frogs) roasted over an open flame, deep in the jungles of the Golden Triangle
Smoked fish sandwiches from a handcart in a tiny port town on an obscure Caribbean island
Bowls of spicy laksa in a Kuala Lumpur outdoor shopping plaza
Chicken rice from a Singaporean street hawker
And I have been banned from even TELLING people what I ate in a tiny mountain village in Laos

Mmm... tasty tasty street meat. Yet, note. The distinct lack of a strong US representation.  This country can produce a senseless war imposed upon an unwilling people... but it can't manage to produce a decent entry in the  street meat category? AMERICA WHERE ARE YOUR PRIORITIES?!?!

Enter the Bacon Wrapped Hot Dog.

A normal hot dog of questionable meat content. And then in a flash that can only be categorized as brilliance, wrapped in bacon.  Grilled to smoky perfection, plied high with various topics of increasing decadence, then nestled in a toasted bun. Ready and waiting for your drunken consumption. A thing of wonder, a thing that restores your faith in  this country's ability to contribute to the global community in any sort of meaningful way.

And with sated stomach, and judgement largely blurred by alcohol, I say, for  the first time in a very very very long time, that I'm proud to be an American... at least until I finish eating that hot dog.

PS - If you hate on the bacon-wrapped hot dog, then the terrorists win.
author: Umami Y.

description:
I finally met you last night.

It was enchanting. 
A moment that will remain in my fuzzy memory forever.

1 bacon-wrapped Hot Dog, please?
Thank You.

Nom Nom Nom Nom...

(20 minutes later)

2 more bacon-wrapped Hot Dogs, on the double! Please?
Thank You.

(10 feet away from BDC)

Nom Nom Nom Nom Belch! Nom Nom Nom Nom...

I probably could have eaten 2 more, except I was out of $$$.
I hope we meet again, sooner rather than later.
author: matt m.

description:
I had absolutely no idea what the hell this thing was.  I was thoroughly, completely, utterly, and totally sauced.  I guess I thought it was some kind of sausage or something.  I swear to god it was so god damn delicious I couldn't believe it.  I immediately ordered a second one, muscling out another patron who was also waiting, and managed to get the last one.  I know the poor fella next to me said something about him being next, but whatever he said was drowned out by my alcohol-soaked brain cells screaming at ground zero of a deliciousness strike.

I still haven't recovered.
author: Matt H.

description:
Has anyone ever REALLY eaten one of these things... sober?

I can't say I have, although I would. Then again, I would also eat the deep fried pig sphincter I saw Anthony Bourdain eat on the Columbia episode of No Reservations. Yeah, I'm down for the unknown, gotta problem with that, ese?

And so, yeah, the idea of a bacon cart on a sidewalk after some late night boozing doesn't really frighten me much. What does frighten me however, are the people that would deny themselves the joy of a hot dog wrapped in bacon. Or anything wrapped in bacon? Shouldn't that be a crime? Or at least worth the same penalty as jay-walking? Sheesh!

Point of the story: Carpe Diem, bitches. You only run around this planet once and if a hot dog cart is weighing in on your list of fears, you have bigger problems. :)
author: Stephy S.

description:
You haven't had a hot dog until you've tried it Mexican-style! Smelling the grilled onions alone are salivating enough, but until you realize there's bacon wrapped around the dog, you wonder what just came over--there must be a god! 

I've only had two of them, and loved them both, although I never had everything on it--I KNOW, I KNOW! There's always next time right? I don't feel right having mayo, mustard, and ketchup on my bacon-wrapped, grilled hot dog since I feel the onions give it so much flavor as it is. It's no wonder why they always give me stink eye whenever I say "No mayo, mustard, or ketchup."

FINE! I'll get "everything" on it next time--geez, what a way to make me feel bad!
author: K. E.

description:
What can we eat passed 2am when the line at el farolito's is too long?

Bacon Dog Cart!

We found the cart around 23rd and Mission once we decided we needed to drive around for food. The grilled onions make this dog worth the $3. Greasy and delicious.
author: Pearl P.

description:
lol so last night after the Elite movie event, after Double Dutch, after (the most fucked up bar I've ever been to) Delirium, I ran into something special... something that took my breath away... something that made my mouth drop.. the fricken Bacon Dog Cart!  Maaaannn was I excited!  I walk up grinning from cheek to cheek, waited in line, then ordered a dog.. then ordered another dog...

G, "Hey you know I use to eat these in TJ?" with a big smile
guy behind cart,"Si"
G," I finally found you I finally found you" pointing at the bacon wrapped dogs. 
gbc with weird look on his face, "No"
G,"Si, you are right here in front of me I found you"
gbc calls his friend over
Friend,"he doesn't speak English"
gbc, *smiles*

I was so excited I didn't even notice the dood didn't know what the hell I was saying so I start pointing..
mayo before the dog then catch up and mustard to top it off.  I give him $5
gbc,'No, six dollas"
G, "I thought you didn't know English?  You know I could get 6 for $6 in TJ"
gbc,"No English."
I smile and thank him then spend the next 20 minutes trying to find a cab.  I almost went back for 2 more.  I finally found you Bacon Dog Cart and I shall be back!!!
author: Jamal G.

description:
I don't know who else noticed, but last Summer all of these carts VANISHED off the face of The Mission. Maybe the one outside Delirium was still going (which says a lot for how well I can avoid 16th Street) but the one outside BofA near my house that I'd come to take for granted lo these years was MIA. At the height of Summer, when you're not only more likely to say to yourself "what a beautiful day that could only be improved by something enrobed in bacon", but you frequently stumble around drunkenly and snacking could save your sloshy life.

But here it is. Maybe the BofA Security guard tracked down the cartmonger and begged him to set up again. Get the bacon-wrapped band back together, so to speak.

And yes, I freely admit that I'm reviewing this "establishment" to get it back in the top Restaurant spot on Yelps homepage. Since there were several carts, Yelp merged all the reviews and the Bacon cart went down to #2. Under a cake place.This will not stand.

Also:

Dear Yelp,

I formally request that you buy out the bacon cart for the next fun Yelp event. No-host bacon dog cart. Needs to happen. Also, to be fair, there should be a phyllo dough wrapped tofu pup meatstitute cart as well. And I'm flexible about the morningstar farms cart. Just to not be a dick, you know. Though I can clearly live with the perception that I am a dick (see my posts in talk). But you know, bacon cart first, THEN boca dog cart. Cool?

best,

Agent J

p.s. Bacon Cart guy/gal, you're awesome. But keep that Gemini rocket mayonnaise dispenser far from me. Gross! On a hot dog? Ew!
author: Jeremy W.

description:
OMG!! OMG!!  It finally happened! To ME!
...no, sorry, I didn't get laid...
I  GOT A BACON WRAPPED HOTDOG.  Which is virtually the same thing as getting laid.  I had a cigarrette afterwards, fo sho'.


**Be sure to have exact $3, cuz these guys can't exactly run to the bank at 12am to break a $50, ya know?**
author: CINDY K.

description: Bacon wrapped hot dog piled with grilled onions when I'm hungry and want food now?  Yes please!  The best thing about this cart is that it's right there when you want it.  Pretty good hot dog, but really great location!  I'm not sure I want to know the health risks of a bacon wrapped hot dog, or the quality of the ingredients, but this really hits the spot.
author: Gabrielle L.

description:
My pallys Eric I'm Rockin'  W. and Matty No Pants H. have oft preached the wonders which are the Bacon Dog Cart to me - every time I have rolled my eyes and said, "Yeah right!  Orgasm for your mouth?  Come on - God Cock?  What?  Seriously - nothing is that good, especially not something which involves a hot dog!"

I hate to admit it (because I will never hear the end of it - EVER) but... I was wrong.

Just dead wrong.

Bacon Dog Cart is JUST like an orgasm for your mouth... it is the ambrosia of the drunk and hungry... it is a little piece of heaven wrapped in bacon with grilled onions on top... it is... I hate to say it... the BEST fucking dinner I've had in a while.

Oh god.
What has become of my life?
author: Kate R.

description: I don't know if this is the same folks that was selling those bacon wrapped hot dogs in front of Ruby Skye last night, but you sure made me feel like it's heaven. Cheddar cheese filled hot dogs wrapped in sizzling bacon strips topped with jalapenos and onions. OMG for $4.. it was BEST part of the night!
author: Jimmie L.

description:
This bacon-hot-dog-onion-ketchup-mustard-mayonnaise piece of heaven made me speak in tongue.  Errrr that could have been the condition I was in when I ate it last night at 2am.  

Q: Is there some sort of tracking device on the cart so I can find one with my pocket GPS next time I'm ambling about the city? 

Nevertheless, this cart belongs on the next cover of 7x7 magazine.
author: Kelly H.

description:
This story is not as exciting as others.  It does not involve being drunk and passing by these carts while falling over.  For that, I apologize, but it's based on being stone cold sober.

I don't know if this corner is THE Bacon Dog Cart, but it's the ONLY one I've seen.  I only get to go on Friday, when I deposit my paycheck at the B of A on 23rd and Mission.  I think this guy has an agreement with the bank, as the security guard kicks the other vendors away.  I'm not a bar-hopping night person, so I am there in the later afternoon.

I could not pass up the smell of bacon and onion cooking together, and had to get one.  While I really couldn't taste the bacon, it was one great dog!  Covered with everything, except peppers, (but I did want the pepper brine!), it was one of the best street dogs ever.  $3 each, I think.

I don't see him often, but when I do I have to stop.  I figure I'll be there every Friday for a while, as my employer does not offer direct deposit of my paycheck yet.  And while it's convenient, I hope they don't so I can get my fix every week.  ONE bacon dog a week is OK, right?

Now I'm hungry.  OK ... NOT more than THREE?
author: Michael M.

description:
Bacon Dog Cart, patron saint of drunk people in SF. How many hangovers or DUIs have you prevented? I'll never know. 

My first encounter with the BDC was stumbling out of 1984 at Cat Club. After 3 vodka sodas, I was pretty peckish. The air was filled with something wonderful. My bloodhound nose followed the scent, which led me to this holy mirage. 

Disgusting, yet delicious. Like the sleazy dude you don't want to admit you have a crush on.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
I can now blame my impending heart failure upon myself. Because seriously, I was not going to get a bacon dog. It was a moment of weakness.

I stood in line [more like crowded around the mob], watching the excitement in everyone's eyes, and ya know what? It must be like how someone who doesn't even watch/enjoy sports will go to a sporting event and then end up all amped up for a team. I caved under the pressure - got all mixed into the madness.  

So hot dog, bacon, onion, mayo, ketchup. An overload to the senses - so much so that I barely tasted the bacon. *tear* Next time, I'm getting it without the mayo. And then another time, I will get it all with the jalapenos too.  

Never the mustard though. Mustard=YUCK.

There's GOT to be more than one of these guys [In fact, there's one every 1.5 blocks on Mission in the early evening!]! And when they find each other, it's going to be an all out Bacon Dog warzone.
author: Tinna H.

description:
good thing i quit smoking because now i can smell bacon wrapped around a fuckin hot dog 7 miles away.

Danger!

The Bacon Dog Death Cart On Wheels.
author: Bean T.

description:
Sizzle shhhhh-shhhhhh sizzle.  Sniffsniff.  What's that?  Bacon dogs?  What?

"Come on, babe, just a sec," I say.  I pause at the bacon dog cart.  "Give me two bacon dogs, everything on 'em.  You want a bacon dog, babe?"

She nods.

"Make that three, actually, make that four bacon dogs."
"Onions?"
"Yeah, just give me everything."

Sizzle shhhhhh-shhhhhhh sizzle.

"We should go dancing at Little Baobab more often, babe.  That was fun."
author: Abendigo R.

description:
-tacky ass location
-"so can i tap that ass tonight?" some guy on his cell walking by
-"minus 1 since they don't have tables" hahahaa
-she jacked up the price to $4 each instead of the $3!
-i love onions tho
-you wouldn't know if the body odor like smell was from the cart or the homeless people hanging out...could it be the clubbers too?
-good idea for those that come out of those clubs famished for more than just pussy, they can have a wiener instead/too
=I DID NOT HAVE THE SQUIRTS (could it be since i skipped the mayo?)
author: serbelle i.

description:
Reasonable for 3 doll hairs, so a good 3.5 stars. Too often when i'm in the Mission, I end up getting Mexican food (thanks El Farolito!), but sometimes I just crave something else. Enter the bacon wrapped hot dog. Now consider me guilty for trying it because its on the 7x7 100 things to eat before you die list, but I had been craving one of these for awhile. Last one I had prior to this past weekend was back in LA after catching a Lakers' game at Staples Center (very nice venue by the way). That dog was amazing, and I wasn't even drunk either.

Fast forward to this past Saturday. It was roughly 2:30, when all hope for trying one of these was fading due to the fact that some friends and I were still trying to leave the SoMa area. By 2:40, our only hope was to swing by Bruno's, only to find out the cart was not there. Tear.

But wait! Some sort of grilling device and two people were hiding behind the bus stop. This led to promptly pulling over and running across the street. Considering there were 4 of us, they still had 6 dogs going on the grill. Success. I paid my 3 bucks and downed it within minutes. All in all, it doesn't compare to the LA dog, but it'll do. Only came with grilled onions, but the bacon wasn't crispy at all, even though I could taste it. 

I'll put it in the 4 star side for being something else to eat besides Mexican food, pizza, donuts, or some sort of Asian  food.
author: Loren John B.

description:
I don't know what the business is called but it sure is clever.  I call them Bacon Wrapped hotdogs.  Others call it Dirty Dogs.  So I am naming their business Dirty Dogs.  I'm sure everyone knows what I'm talking about.

When you're clubbing or bar hopping, you cannot resist that bacony, grilled oniony smell luring around the area.  You follow your senses and you see the 3 amigos with their portable restaurant.  That's right, that BACON wrapped hot dog fresh outta the fryin pan with grilled onions, ketchup, mustard and MAYO.  They know what you want when you want it.  This always hits the spot for me.  3 dollars for one but who cares! you're drunk as everyone else!  It's the best thing you need after drinking and dancing.  Dirty Dog - best thing after Drinking and Dancing. DD after D & D.  holler.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Yes, they are darn good, and these dogs have saved me from a vicious hangover on more than one occasion, but note that we, as Americans, are getting ripped off here too on this one. We are paying more than 4 times the amount for a much lesser quality dog than they serve on any of the streets throughout Mexico, and especially in the Zona Rosa in DF. Understandably, we'll have to factor for PPP, but still, come on guys, give us better bacon around the dogs and provide us with those wonderful condiments that made this dish famous. True, true, I know it would be difficult to have multiple toppings without permits and while running from the Po',,, but I promise you, first one to do this will retire early and comfortably, and you're great-grandchildren will cherish you. If anyone knows of a hotDog guy that already does this, please let me know...
author: Brian J.

description:
Minus 1 star! 

Dirty dog cart: where were you on the 4th of july? We drove up and down your usual streets and you took the day off. We had to get nachos instead.

Boo. How we missed you!
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
Okay. So the real reason these hombres get a whopping 4-stars is for one reason, and one reason only:

They hit the spot after a night of binge-drinkin' in the Mission.

PLUS their dogs have bacon wrapped around 'em.
(crap, that's 2 reasons!! whatever...)

Fortunately for them, very much like the phenomena of eau du pizza, it doesn't matter how not hungry I am, if I smell bacon it's all over! I get my fix on Friday nights across the street from Lazslo/Foreign Cinema.

Now step aside and pass the mayo...
author: Tiffinie T.

description:
They had a Bacon Hot Dog Cart outside the Hollywood Bowl in LA last Sunday.  I wasn't drunk, but I HAD TO HAVE ONE...because it's rare when I get to have one, and the ones in SF are FSDRA! (*Fukin-Stoopid-Dumb-Retarded-Awesome!).

The LA ones SUCK.  Mine was almost RAW.  I could see the whiteness of the soft bacon fat.  The onions were virtually uncooked.  I took one bite and threw it away.  Waste of $4.

The ones outside the Cat Club on Thursday nights after "1984" are WAAAAAAY  BETTER.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Edit 01/2008: I had a Bacon Hot Dog in Hollywood, and I retract my previous comment.  That one was better than the SF ones,  I have to say...
author: Van Ness D.

description:
Writing a review for this "place" is akin to writing a review for Snakes on a Plane. 

You know exactly what you're getting, and you know it's going to be great.

4.5 stars only though for not being open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
author: Tien N.

description:
Alright those that know me best know I live and breathe in SOMA and the mission for the most part these days. 

I've been wanting to try these tasty dogs for quite a while and boy, when you're hammered and coming out of that bar at 2am do they smell good! I finally had to give in and get myself one although I somehow suspected these wouldn't be the best dawgs. 

And I was right. Bacon tastes good, although the hot dog tastes very famililar..oh yes. Its a ballpark hot dog...the crappiest hot dog in existence and not even worthy of  the bacon that wraps it. I think the bacon wrap is just to entice you with the smell.  Then again I've gotten these 3 times and each time I wish I was at Farolito's or even at the place outside Supperclub. 

Oh well -- 3 stars because I can't resist it even though each time I regret it.
author: Morgan H.

description:
So we stumble out of Bruno's because that's what people do.  An intoxicating smell washes over us.  We let the smell guide us to the corner, where the bacon-wrapped hot dog cart was waiting for us with open arms.

Give me one, with ketchup and mayo, and extra grilled onions.

So what if I burnt my lips eating that first bite because I was an eager beaver?

So what if I dropped my last bite because I was too giddy to hold on too tightly?

Sigh...til next time...
author: Jenny L.

description:
Hello Urban Legend Cart,

I had heard about you just last weekend from my cousin. The sound of the great myth sounded too good to be true, with my mouth salivating as he spoke. We were at Tonga Room and decided not to order their salty food. Well, it didn't take long to conjure up a  group of 4 and go on our "bacon dog" journey in the Mission. 2 cars driving all over Mission not knowing exactly where this cart would be parked.

We mistook homeless men with shopping carts as the bacon dog cart and were shattered with disappointment. We tried to let our noses guide us but were unsuccessful. Finally after 15 minutes of u-turns and driving around, we came closer. We saw stands outside of random restaurants. I got out and asked the guy if he was the "infamous" cart. He pointed in another direction. We got in our car and drove a few more blocks on 19th/Mission and were finally greeted by this HUGE yellow flag that screamed HOTDOG. It was lovely. I knew it had to be it. We parked and walked over. Indeed, in front of the truck lied a small teeny cart and a woman cooking our treasure -- bacon wrapped hotdogs. We ordered ($3 each), and devoured next to a trio of homeless men. And like that, our mission was complete and sadly over. 

Until next time...
author: Jeanne C.

description:
This is the first time I saw a bacon dog cart in North Beach.  Didn't surprise me to find I had passed five of them walking from 24th and mission to 18th and mission.

This one was near Powell and Bay.

Make sure to ask for yours extra crispy. ;)
author: Theron L.

description:
This cart gets going relatively early, considering that most of its business has to be the late-night crowd.  I typically pass it around 7 or 8 on my way to the ATM before a night out.  At this point, they're just getting started, and the smell of sizzling bacon-dogs makes me feel slightly ill.  My resolve is hardened - nothing could convince me to partake in this artery-clogging excess.  

Fast-forward to the end of my drunken night - I once again pass the Bacon Dog cart, and all of my defenses are obliterated - this smell has me in its clutches.  Somehow they only appeal when it's dark . . .
author: Natalie S.

description:
Use your nose and find these guys when they work out of their vans on Mission St.

Pure genius.
author: Meh M.

description:
Yo

To the dude down there who gave a one star rating: shame on you. Anyway, the bacon dog cart holds a very special cholesterol-filled place in my heart, and I find myself crying whenever I can't find one of these carts, especially late at night when I exit the club tipsy, with two honeys on each arm and cocaine residue on my nostrils and ears. Ladies.

These hot dogs are to die for, and although ironically you would probably die from eating too many of them, I would buy a bacon dog off these dudes even if I wasn't hungry. Word is bond.

CULOOOOOOO

yelp make me elite
author: Edmund C.

description:
Holler to the vegetariyelpers:

Well this one time I was super hungry and actually sober coming out of a bar on Mission st.  And there was the Bacon Dog Cart.  

Seeing as I don't actually eat meat, I opted for the peppers and onions on a bun.  Because really, the smell will seduce you.

The nice man charged me one dollar for my meal and it was still worth So Much More.
author: Allison G.

description:
Oh bacon-wrapped hotdog cart, I love you so. I usually meet you outside Delirium... but I have not been in too long. I miss you. I wrote you this haiku:

Bacon wrapped hotdog
I long for your warm embrace
Only three dollars
author: Ben Y.

description:
I love you bacon dog cart.  You know what I want, before I even know.  Something so wrong, that is so right.

Super Delicious, and full service!  they dress it for you, probably because they know you are way too drunk to be handling a ketchup squeezy bottle.
author: Jackie M.

description:
Well, well, well.... what can I say about the bacon dog cart that has not already been said by over 200+ reviews? Thought I would be the first to yelp a place with no address, but 200 yelpers have beat me to it. So I guess I have to keep this short and simple...

When you hear the sizzling of the bacon fat melting, smell the grilling of the fresh onions, and see the crowd of people walking in the same direction feeling the same way you do about bacon wrapped hot dogs, follow your senses to this delicious destination. Don't fight it. You know it's good. 

Recommendations: 
Obviously...Bacon Wrapped Hot Dog 
Run 5 miles.
author: Lisa T.

description:
I have found Mecca...and it is called The Bacon Dog Cart.

Of course being on Yelp, I can't help but notice how this is always voted the highest rated food "establishment", but of course I had my doubts.  "Surely that can't be right, can it?!"  "Surely it must be overrated!!"  No doubt reviewed by hung-over-binge-drinkers who would rate a cart selling cardboard boxes as being the food of the gods.

I was proven wrong.

It was just another Wednesday night out, and having had my fill of the smoke filled back room of Delirium, my friends and I were on our way home when lo and behold, I turn to my right and discover this infamous cart!  It was like finding the lost city of Atlantis, the shroud of Turin!!  I made a beeline for the cart, my friends following, confused by my shrieks of glee as I happened upon the greasy goodness of bacon wrapped hot dogs and sizzling onions.  I was like a kid on Christmas morning, Ralphie's Dad pre-Turkey (and Bumpus' dogs), a virgin bride on her wedding night... (hmm, scratch that last one).  Needless to say, there was much anticipation and I think the guys at the cart were slightly afraid of my wild, glistening eyes as I surveyed the deliciousness before me.

Of course I had to order "the works" and I think the guys were amused by my friend and I's attempts to order in Spanish.  "Si, quiero uno con todo y para my amiga vegeteriana (wtf?!), uno solamente cebollas y ketchup y mustard."  Of course then they started having an actual conversation with us and all was lost...still, I could hardly worry about that with this behemoth meal before mine eyes.  My first bite was bliss, the second bite orgasmic....yes, it was that quick!  It was gone before I knew it, but I will never forget that joyous experience and will hopefully relive it again in the not too distant future.

Muchos gracias senores para coronario!  El corazon gracias ustedes!!
author: Melanie N.

description:
One of my most guiltiest pleasures is the bacon dog.

It's so sick and disgusting. Like a hot dog, for one... and then add bacon to it. It's so bad.

I was introduced to this one when after a drunken night in Castro, we were walking back to the Mission. My friend Ayn who is a resident of the Mission was like, we are going to sniff out the bacon dog. She had the sensor in her nose (I'm jealous) and she sprinted across the street and next thing you know...

It was gluttonous bliss.

But I read the review about someone getting sick and it's totally one of those things where you have to take into account that you are drunk when eating these. So as it goes, the person cooking them is probably drunk as well.

Mmmm...
author: Kim D.

description:
Bacon dog carts out here have NOTHING on the bacon dog carts in LA. For 3 bucks you get a sorry ass Oscar Meyer frank wrapped in one piece of bacon. The dude ripped the shit out of my bun with his tongs, then he looked at it as if deciding whether he was gonna still give it to me or do the right thing and replace it. He gave it to me. 

For 3 bucks in LA at the bacon dog cart you get a big ass all beef dog. The people out there that work the carts aren't schysters like out here either. I've seen people drop there dogs out there only to have 'em replaced by the cart lady. No way would that shit happen out here, especially if the guy tried to give me a fucked up bun knowing full well that he fucking ripped it to shit with his tongs!!! Some people.....


EDIT: I cannot believe that people actually like the bacon dog cart out here. I'm with Keane on this one, you guys are suckers.
author: Tommy P.

description: So I finally got to try a bacon wrapped hot dog the other day, after constantly passing by these carts being too drunk to stop.  The bacon wrapped hot dog itself is pretty tasty and not oily at all, or mine wasn't at least.  The condiments were kinda packed on my hot dog, Wayyyyy too much onions, bell pepers, jalapenos, etc ... I had to remove the majority of it in order for me to even taste the bacon wrapped hot dog.  Plus it is a bit pricey for a hot dog ($3/each), but whatever ... when your drunk and need food, this is the way to go.
author: Pia V.

description:
I love the bacon dogs.  

Or what I know as the Hollywood Hotdog sold from a cart in front of all the clubs in LA and on a daily basis in Santee Alley.  

These things are bomb and a previous addiction of mine, extending several years.

Who knew something so delish could come from a grody little cart in the middle of the night for a couple bucks.  

Well, enjoy this is unhealthy midnight snack.  

It's soo good in a soo bad for you kinda way!
author: Kat R.

description:
Unlike most reviewers I can embarrassingly say that I have eaten more than one of these sober. I still think they're the best thing I've ever had in my mouth.

I have never thrown one up and I will actually walk several blocks out of my way at 3 in the morning just to find one. 

I have dreamt about these hot dogs. Seriously. I have also contemplated stealing a cart so that I can eat 10 without paying and looking like a fat ass.
author: Caitlin C.

description:
These reviews are part of a series where my Vancouverite friend wanted to try a bunch of food carts all weekend.  We ended up deviating to some other cheap eats.

The contestants:  Lers Ros Thai, Fritzj, Adobo Hobo, Pizza Hacker, Gumbo Cart, Lumpia Cart, Bi-Rite Creamery, El Farolito, Bacon Dog Cart, Pho Garden, Zante's Indian Pizza

This review is about the Bacon Dog Cart.  Dude, where are you guys?  I read all the reviews about where to find you.  I trolled up and down the Mission late at night with my face sticking out in the freezing drizzle just to smell you out!  Alas could not find out after 30 minutes of driving around the mission on a cold night.  Very disappointed.  You guys should twitter like all the other food carts to save us some time.  Maybe next time!
author: Susan L.

description:
Even dog haters love this.
My 5 stars for saving me from my drunken munchies at 1am.  

YES! My nose knows best...I followed the scent of the bacon hot dogs to the guy standing on the street corner with his little grill cart thingamabob. At last, I found you!  

Really, I hate hot dogs. But bacon wrapped hot dogs on a late night craving of junk food tops it. Not much to it, guy was friendly, paid the guy $3 & I toped the dog off with jalapenos. 

Open up your nostrils and it'll lead you to the BDC!
author: Catherine O.

description:
Same night I ate a bacon dog, I walked barefoot in the mission.
BAREFOOT IN THE MISSION.

Thank god he still speaks to me; I don't know if I could support that kind of (mis)judgment in a girl.

Maybe it's because I introduced both he & I to the long heard of mission bacon dog.
Bacon wrapped hot dog at 2:30 am.  Awesome.
author: laura g.

description:
I've been waiting FOREVER for this to make it's way to NorCal... I'd only experienced it after clubbing down in SoCal.

Hot Dog?  Great!
Bacon?  Awesome!
Bacon wrapped hot dog?  Awesomely great!  
Eating a bacon wrapped hot dog after a night of drinking?  So f'ing great it's beyond words.

If you haven't tried one yet, try it.  I'll be on the lookout for 'em next time I'm in the Mission...
author: Allan H.

description:
They found their niche. Drunks in the Mish and Soma. 

Yeah, I crave it; I buy it; I eat it; I'm done with it.

What...you want gourmet shit at 2am?
author: Ted P.

description: Saturday night at 2 am, this is what I go searching for. Greasy, messy, but so delicious! Get it with everything, including jalapenos and mayo!
author: Diana L.

description: Yes I'm giving it 5 stars. So simple yet sooo good. But be warned. Once you've had bacon hot dog with the works, you might not go back to regular dogs. I don't eat regular dogs anymore because of this.  If you've never tried you must try it once after a night of intoxication.  The tastiest snack for drunks hands down. Don't ask how I know just do it.
author: Win C.

description:
So the Bacon Dog Carts went to the Castro for Pride weekend, but they are the same company as the mission district reviews.... 

YUMMMM! My clearest memory was of Pride Weekend kick-off Friday night was of how much I wanted sausage. Being straight and staring at hot half naked guys making out all night made me want to get some sausage and go back to my bf's house... What can I say? So, I see the bacon dog cart. I immediately run up to him and tell him how much I love him and how much I love sausage and bacon and hot dogs. I order one and scarf it down. It's soooo tasty and all I can think is, I already finished it?? No way! So of course, I order another one. My friends covered theirs with tons of toppings and didn't taste the bacon apparently. They still don't believe their was bacon on theirs but don't worry... they are wrapped in bacon. The next morning I woke up to text messages asking me if I still needed sausage. 3 in one night, almost an overload! ;)  ;)
author: Ali R.

description:
Remember the cartoons where the smell of food lures the character to wherever the scent is coming from?  That's what the Bacon Dog Cart does to all the drunkards in the Mission late at night.  (I was one of those drunkards)

Even though I can buy a six pack of hot dogs and buns at the market for the price I payed for 1 bacon dog ($4), I still bought it (mainly because I was intoxicated).  

I really didn't remember what exactly was in the hot dog or what condiments I put to top it off but I did remember the explosion of flavors in my mouth and after each bite I was seeing angels and waterfalls and unicorns and all things that make me happy flying around.
author: Danny P.

description:
Would warrant a solid 5 stars if I was not so tainted by the original Mexican hot dog as found in Tijuana.  Similarly made with salsa in addition the chance of it actually being made of REAL dog in Mexico made it that much more enticing south of the border.

These do hold up well being so far from the originator but without the added element of danger.  Would have given it a full 5 stars if not for that fact as well as it being nearly 3-4x as much as the originals.

Keeping with the theme, bathrooms are in excess wherever the Bacon Dog Cart can be found.  Just watch out for 5-0 while you urinate on the sidewalk.
author: D Y.

description: Hands down this is one of the best things that can happen to a person after midnight in the mission! Also, I am not a mayo fan but trust me on this, GET IT WITH MAYO! They are so fast and delish! This is the only reason to leave the club with cash still in your pocket!
author: Alicia K.

description: Tried this for the first time at Pride last year. One word, yum!
author: Kristin E.

description:
as i walked toward La Corenta around 7pm, i saw the guy with his YELP FAMOUS BACON DOG CART!!

he's like a CELEBRITY on YELP!!!

the bacon hot dogs does smell really good but sadly, i decided to eat a burrito instead.

hmm...is he ALWAYS on the same corner?! 

the bacon hot dog man must be ONE RICH MOFO by now.
author: Carol Y.

description: What more could you possibly want more after a good night of drinking than some good old street meat.  But what's better than meat cooked on a greasy grill on the street corner..... meat wrapped with meat.  These are quite possibly the best hotdogs I have ever eaten....and I swear I would feel the same way about them sober too.
author: Dawn R.

description:
it's so depressing how I sometimes dream about this hot dog cart and wake up pissed.

I always get my hot dog with bacon (and i DON'T even eat pork!), extra onions, and tons o' condiments.  There's nothing like a potential heart attack at 2AM, dressed like a streetwalker after the clubs.  But it's worth it.

Guys, it's a great place to hit on chicks.  One time a guy next to me asked me if I wanted to get to know his delicious hot dog.  No thank you.
author: S L.

description:
hooly crap look athe time, iss likhe three I needhta get home okay how minny drinkss did I dinkh ha ha uh-oh but SOOOOO humghry and MAN what iss uph with that BAYCHCHN SMELL? Oh CRAP wazzhiz that ghuy sellin is that HOT DOGS WRAPPED IN BACHCHYN? OOOH YEAHGIMMETWOOFTHEMRIGHTNOW! Oh ghad why ishhe takingh sooofreakhin longh? (swallows massive quantities of saliva while waiting an eternity of exactly 27 seconds)

MMMMMMMMMMHHHHGHGRMGH thushish show ghud . . . (ketchup/mustard dribbling on party shirt) MGHMHGHM . . . dude maykh me another one . . . .
author: Karsten P.

description:
Munch, munch, munch. 

Person 1: "Man, hotdogs are so good."
Person 2: "Yeah, dude, seriously. Especially when you're wasted. And with , like, sauerkraut and shit."
Person 1: "Dude, yeah. Totally."

Person 3: "Yeah, what if it was wrapped in bacon?"

Altogether: "Yeah!"
Person 1: "Yeah, totally!"

(Industrious and brilliant guy in the Mission overhears this and starts the world's greatest culinary experience: Bacon Dog Cart.)

The End
author: Cameron O.

description:
It's hard to find a meal for $5 nowadays, let alone $3. I'm not saying that if you spend $3 on a hot dog wrapped in bacon you will walk away full, but you'll get pretty damn close. 

God touches each hot dog wrapped in bacon.

Satan does too.
author: Killian E.

description:
Dude this is exactly what's wrong with Yelp. Anyone who gave the bacon dog cart more than two stars is an f*ing idiot. It's a FUCKING BACON WRAPPED HOT DOG! Come on! 4 1/2 stars for this shit? Are you serious? Even when you're super faded they're barely passable...

Pros: Always there when you really need it. Kitsch appeal.
Cons: Really does taste like crap. Careful asking for it with "everything", for god knows what reason they add buttloads of nasty mayonaise (sp?).
author: Tom B.

description: hey I was sober! I got in line for a second one..( im not in the mission area often) and the guy wants to call it Jessicas hot dogs after his wife!!
author: MiLLie M.

description:
Alright. I admit it. I'm one of those bacon dog junkies that actually goes driving around trying to find a cart to satisfy my late night craving. I'm one of those who can eat more than one. And I get everything on it. With extra onions. 

Really though...How can you go wrong with a bacon wrapped hot dog? Unless of course you don't like bacon or hot dogs but...how can you go wrong with a bacon wrapped hot dog?! And at three bucks, it's the ultimate late night snack. Greasy, salty, tasty goodness. It's heaven in a bun.
author: Christine L.

description:
5 for being consistently available during the early morning hours... 


One night we went to Levende... and for some reason we got it stuck into our heads that one bacon-wrapped hot dog costs only $2.50 so that's all we saved from the club... We had already asked the hotdog cart man to make our dogs, so when we paid and he saw how short we were, he gave us the "are you serious?" face... he corrected us that we owed him more, and after we told him that's all we had he just let the hotdogs go... Man we felt hella bad, it's bad enough he's pushing a dog cart, he had to hook us up... We made sure to come back the following Thursday to pay him the extra $2.00 ...
author: Chrysantha C.

description: the first 2 bites are good. the bacon smell traps you when you are slightly drunk.. like a hot asian gold-digging chick who's really there to sniff all the money out of your wallet. not really worth it. may give you stomac problems the next morning.. better off getting a real meal instead!
author: Alexander Kiwi L.

description:
It was another random week night spent at a bar. This time it was Kilowatt in the Mission. After a couple hours of hanging out with friends drinking delicious pints it was time to trek back to the East Bay. Upon reaching the Bart Station my friend Greydon U noticed the aroma of hot dogs and bacon permeating the night air. We immediately spotted the kart and ran up to get bacony goodness. 

Having skipped dinner I was so ready for a hot dog wrapped in bacon with jalapenos and onions. Sadly the kart vendor only took cash and I was all out as I had just spent it at the bar. This is where the story could have ended in a sad note, me hungry with no bacon wrapped goodness but Greydon U being the good friend that he is noticed my lack of funds and bought me a hot dog!!

The bacon was crisp and the hot dog was plump and juicy. The jalopenos added the perfect heat and the onions finished the whole treat. 

It was very good and I most definitely will get one again next time I see the kart. Be warned the hot dogs are served very hot, so its best to let them cool a little before eating them. I sadly had to learn this hard way and loose half my tongue for a few days.
author: Alex R.

description:
If I could give this place 3.5 stars, I would mainly because I would purchase again.  For starters, I'm just happy it's not dirty water hot dog.  I wouldn't even have tried it if it was.  The grilled onions and peppers and the bacon wrapped hot dogs make this hot dog well worth it for $3.  The only issue I had with it was it wasn't that hot.  Would I get this hot dog at 2AM in the Mission?  Only if I had $3!  If I had $5 or $6, I'm getting a taco or burrito.  It's still good, but I prefer to spend double at Rosamunde for a fantastic hot dog.

Some of these 5 star drunk reviews are funny.  Anything short of a sh!t sandwich will taste great after a night of drinking.

easy to find on 22nd & Mission.. or around there
good service
parking is difficult, metered
author: John D.

description:
Saved once again by the holy bacon wrapped hot dog, except this time, i was coherent to actually enjoy and see what I was eating.  But tell me why first, this stuff is $4 now????

I'm sorry, but it seems too much for this, as mUCH as the smell does travel for blocks and the closer you get, the stronger the message in your head says "eat me."

But, I would imagine if I was drunker, I'd probably say $4 is nothing, gimme that hot dog!

And you need to tell them to hold off on the mayo, because they'll load everything on there: ketchup, mustard, and mayo to just paint that already greasy hot dog with a thick layer of sauce.....lovely.  Still though, it's sooooo good
author: Vincent K.

description:
WOW crack on a bun! The aroma was calling for me, from inside Holy Cow.. right when I was leaving Holy Cow.... i smelled the bacon, it was calling my name! It was screaming BRIAN! BRIAN! EAT ME!... i was drunk and hungry.. and wow let me tell you.. IT HIT THE SPOT! RIGHT ON! BULLS EYE! CHA CHING! 

The Bacon wrapped around the Sausage, gives it such great flavor, i believe the grilled onions are grilled with the bacon fat!.. i hope so, because that would be the best thing ever! Top the Dog with some mayo, ketchup and mustard.. you have yourself a Grade AA hot dog! 

The Bacon Dog was so good that i stuffed it down to fast down my throat that i coughed it back up and into my friends face! SORRY ALAINA! hahaha... This hot dog will satisfy any ones drunken hunger!
author: Brian P.

description:
After drinking one night, we had to find the legend that is....
The Bacon Wrapped Hot Dog....  

And upon doing my research here on Yelp, I noticed that one of the pics of the Bacon Wrapped Dog had Beauty Bar in the background so that is the intersection we went checking at first and low and behold, it appeared out of the corner of our eyes....

Sweet!  So the corner is 19th and Mission and once we got to the stand, we asked the guy if they were there all the time.  He said that they are here every Friday and Saturday nights from 10p until about 2:30a

A great combination of meat, bread, sauce, grilled onions...  I think it does probably taste better after a night of drinking but it would probably taste pretty damn good without a night of drinking...  

However....  if you haven't drank that night and got a little buzz on, you might feel extremely guilty eating one of these puppies...  So my suggestion is to get buzzed and then come to order your guilty pleasure......  Happy Eating!!!
author: Mark W.

description:
Um.  I don't like hot dogs that much.  And despite my claims otherwise, I really don't love bacon.  And truth be told, drunk food usually just makes me vomit.

But bacon dog isn't like the others.  Bacon dog is special.

Onions, jalapenos, mayo, ketchup, and mustard topped off my new best friend.  When I get wasted at a bar usually my friends just let me go off to terrorize myself and others.  But not bacon dog.  Bacon dog says 

"Here, Coco, I am a delicious entity and I want to give of myself to you.  I will make it okay.  I will take care of you so you don't throw up or black out.  I'm gonna take away the spinning drunkenness while tasting oh so good.  And you're not gonna regret this in the morning, I promise."

Come to think of it, bacon dog might be more than a friend.  Bacon dog might be my man for life.  Which is good, since the motherfucker is bound to make me so fat that nobody else will want me.
author: Coco D.

description:
I could have sworn I heard a choir of angels when I finally saw nirvana, aka the bacon dog cart.  I had heard wonderful, beautiful things about this joyful experience previously unknown to me and lo, the truth was spoken.

It's a hot dog. Wrapped in bacon.  With grilled onions (and jalapenos if you so choose).  Holy shit.  :) :) :)
author: Sus... B.

description:
22nd and Mission is where it's at.

Bacon is bombtastic, hot dogs are bombtastic, together they will BLOW YOUR MIND.

Four dollars for a bacon-wrapped hot dog, bacon-y fried onions and peppers, ketchup and mayonnaise, and a doughy bun is without question the best way you could ever possibly spend your hard-earned money.

Bring on the pork.
author: Katina M.

description:
BACON DOG CART #1

Screw mission bacon dog cart.  The original and still the best is on FOLSOM STREET down the street from KAT CLUB AND ICON LOUNGE

They are regularly in front of 1125 folsom from 10pm ish to 3 or 4 am.
3 bucks for a yummy bacon dog with grilled onions and jalapenos!

"do you have a name?  nombre?"
"Si.  Hot Dog"
"Folsom Street Hot Dog?"
"Si"

UPDATE:
me: you need a tip jar!
bacon dog guy: [blank stare]
me: you will see when you get a tip jar how happy you will be!
bacon dog guy: [blank stare]
me: TIP JAR! [then walks away]
author: Matt N.

description:
There is nothing like walking out of a club at 2am, drunk and starving, only to be overwhelmed with the smell of bacon and hotdogs. This is probably the only state of mind I could be in to actually crave and eat one of these things. For three bucks, you get a big, delicious, juicy hot dog (cooked to order) with all the fixings.

I am not a huge hot dog fan. In fact, I only really crave hot dogs when I am in New York and pass by a street vendor, but these are a yummy close second. Let the aroma win you over and try one.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
This is the best thing I've ever put in my mouth. No phone number, no address, no set hours makes these guys the most elusive chefs in SF. Find them on a corner on 16th st. in the Mission on the weekends (in front of Delirium). Can someone buy these dudes a phone? 

Bacon + onions + mayonaise + ketchup + jalapenos = I don't even think words can sum up how good it is. 

This is the kind of food you eat before you get executed. In fact, I think that author Rudyard Kipling actually died while eating one of these hotdogs. Either that, or he had a severe hemorrhage; I'm no historian.
author: Steven H.

description:
I ate here twice in the past week, and i was drunk both times, so I don't even remember what they tasted like.  

But they probably tasted good.
author: Steve S.

description:
Given my high cholesterol, probably not the best choice... Tubular processed mystery meat, wrapped in cured meat... Angioplasty here I come! No regrets though, not like I eat this stuff everyday. Though if I could find this elusive cart, I might partake more often... Seriously this cart is like the Lost City of Atlantis, it only appears during the full moon and you can find it if you know where to look... 

Maritime legends aside, this cart is ingenious. The perfect late night snack after accomplishing a Mission District bar hopping mission. Served with grilled peppers and onions so you feel a little less guilty(plus they create a large scale flavor party in a bun). Squirt on a little mustard and this is one part of the night you'll be sure to remember(probably the only part of the night). 

Bottom Line: Though I've been unsuccessful at finding this little gem since that first wonderful night of destiny, I will see you again someday... Cart stalkers unite!
author: Greydon U.

description:
Some nights you get out of a club and think... I could go for a hot dog..  Other nights, you're really in the mood for some pre-morning bacon.  Well some genius combined the two and the whole is greater than the sum of its parts.  

Hardest working dude in the world...if he and the Tamale Lady had a kid, I think it would be the second coming.

The list of things that make me roam the Soma at 4 in the morning is awful short.... but this is number one with a bullet.
author: Neej M.

description:
There are so many reasons for loving the bacon dog carts... I love how the amazing smell of sauteed onions mixes with the even more amazing smell of cooked hot dogs with the most amazing smell of frying bacon -- and I love how it's the signature scent of the Mission at night.

Other people might only eat bacon dogs when they're drunk -- it is the perfect late-night greasy gut bomb, isn't it? My love for them transcends beer hunger - I enjoy my bacon-wrapped hot dogs stone cold sober. That's right ladies and gents, I don't drink.

I'm pretty sure that my unreasonable love for bacon dogs has something to do with my religion: Pork tastes better when you're Jewish. I think it's a shame thing.
author: Amy Z.

description:
The bacon wrapped hot dog beats out pizza and diner food as the best late night drunk food! What the vendor cooks it on looks pretty nasty, but be assured, it is delicious! Make sure you ask for jalapeos to top the dog off (free of charge), because it adds a little extra kick that puts this baby over the top. 

I have had this delicacy on 16th and Valencia in front of Skylark (there's usually always one around here) and also in front of Holy Cow. And it should only cost you $3. I'm sure you could probably even bargain with the guy if you buy more than one, but I've never tried it.

EDIT: Went to Endup last night and the cart was waiting outside. Ordered two hot dogs, but downsized to one after those guys tried to take advantage of me and my friends coming out of a club at 5AM, by charging us $4 a dog!!!!! Wtf?
author: Rod M.

description: This is possibly one the better hot dogs I will ever have in my life. I don't know who came up with it, but I'm thankful because it's so amazing and beautiful. Thank you.
author: April D.

description:
I've had you twice in the past Holiday week!!!!

DAY AFTER CHRISTMAS:
Turns out the day after Christmas when meeting some old friends for the holidays around 16th & Mission bars. After getting a bit tipsy....me and my man were craving for some dogs. After splitting a Burrito at a local taqueria due to the request for Mexican late night run with the out of towners..my bf and I still had bacon dogs thoughts on the mind. On the walk back to the car, the lovely smell of you lead me to a cart and of course we weren't gonna skip out on this chance one. My friends from so cal denied a dog on me, but I forced each of them to take a bite of mine and just try it...they both came back for a second bite.....HAHA....Oh yes turning people on to these, one person at a time

NEW YEAR'S EVE:
We brought in 2009 at a party located near the Embarcedero. Because my feet were in pain from wearing heels for 4+ hours and because my guy was hungry, we left the party at around 12:30 to satisfy both our needs. We drove all the way to the Mission for these lovely dogs....1 for me and 2 for my man.  He went out to get them and he brought them back for us to eat in the car. As I looked up a chick was staring at me and gave me two thumbs ups....I nodded my head with a super happy confirmation grin and devoured it in seconds.....

I asked my man....how much....for each...he said $4.....holy crap...so therefore I still can't give them 5 stars due to the price. When I arrived home all around the same time as my sisters we all shared NYE stories, including the fact that each of us had bacon dog that night. Happy 2009 to us all!
author: Cathy D.

description:
I've discovered that bacon dogs differ depending on my level of sobriety.  To be totally honest, they're just ok when I'm sober.  In this state, I'm aware that the dog has been sitting on the grill for quite a while and is all shriveled.  It's sort of dry and unexciting.
But, in my drunken state, it's a whole other deal.  I revel in the greasiness and gobble up every bit of grilled onion, bacon, and dog.  I can eat 3 in a row with no end in sight, except that since they've gotten more expensive each time I buy one, I have to save $ for more drinks.  And then, more bacon dogs....
author: Jessica L.

description:
I love ALLLLL hotdogs! From fancy smancy apple turkey hot dogs topped with foie gras, cheez whiz and toasted almonds on a french bread bun covered in garlic (ok I'm exagerating and that just sounds nasty) to Costco $1.50 hotdogs. And these bad boys... are by far... one of my top 3!

Seriously... hot dogs grilled in a pile of bacon grease, wrapped in bacon and COVERED with onions grilled IN BACON GREASE?! It just doesn't get any better than that!!! Not for me anyways. But then again, I'm a huge fan of bacon and it's grease. YUMMMM.... bacon grease...

Save yourself some time and just order 2-3 at once cause after the first one, you're gonna want another. Trust me. 

Sidenote: This guy and the one on Folsom St. should fight over my love. I'm seriously stuck in a love triangle and just don't know which one to chose. Can you truly be in love with TWO hot dog carts simultaneously? Maybe I'm greedy. Maybe I'm a whore. But they both have my heart (and stomach).
author: Beverly T.

description:
These hot dogs are deeeeeliiiciiiiooous. 

Minus 1 star because I can feel all that grease clogging my arteries after every bite I take....maybe that should be minus 4 stars..but they are just tooo good.
author: Marlene L.

description: I felt like Scooby Doo following the scent trail, one that people watching on TV could actually see. The scent trail had a persona - poking and slapping my head if I was distracted in any way. The bacon dog was every  bit as satisfying as catching the ghost and saving the candy factory.
author: Mike C.

description:
YUMMY YUMMY YUMMY!

Bacon Dog Cart is the perfect thing to curb that after club hankerin' for something greasy,salty, and just plain bad for you.

Bacon Dog Cart evenings go a little something like this...from what I hear:

9:00pm - open bottle of wine with boyfriend & a few  friends.

9:15pm - first ever gravity b. experience (1/2 gallon milk jug for those who are interested)...no, I never did it in college

9:30pm - open 2nd & 3rd bottle of wine amongst friends

9:45pm - 2nd gravity b.

10:30 - take taxi & arrive at club and commence dancing ass off

1:45am - Exit club and catch a whiff of something strangely familiar yet totally unknown

1:46am - Follow nose and arrive at Bacon Dog Cart and am amazed and confused by what I see before me

 1:47am - Take first bite  of bacon dog....HOLY SHIT this is awesome!

2:00am - in bed, tummy fed, happy girl.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Ever seen a friend enjoy the best hot dog they've ever eaten only to throw up those hotdogs an hour later??  I have.  It was in no way due to the hotdog, but due to the amount of alcohol that person consumed prior to ingesting that deliciously bacon wrapped taste of heaven.
I tried to resist eating this heart attack waiting to happen hotdog, but after seeing everyone scarf down two in a row, I just had to find out for myself!!
Always a good time at the bacon wrapped hotdog cart guaranteed!!  Plus there was a drunk petite white girl from the club asking for a bite of everyone's hotdog...that was entertaining for 15 minutes....
author: Mikey L.

description: What do you call a hot dog wrapped in bacon and topped with grilled onions in the palm of your hand on a cold fall day? It's perfection.
author: Olivia D.

description:
We stepped out of the 16th & mission BART and there it was. You could smell the bacon while riding the escalator. It seems perfect for a snack before hitting the bars, but I think now that if you go bacon dog first and bar second you're doing it all backwards and you'll end up with the experience I had.

You all had my expectations so high, and it sounds so perfect on paper, but it was good. Not orgasmic, not even fantastic or heavenly. Just good, bordering on really good.

I didn't need those fans anyway. So there.
author: matthew r.

description:
I already know they're bad for you.  It may even have caused my stomachache and hangover the next morning, but I still ate it and enjoyed it. 

And if you ask me, I'll probably order the same thing, but skipping the mayo. Where's the chaser?!
author: Young P.

description:
HOLEY FREAKING HELL.   THANK YOU TO THE PERSON THAT CREATED A YELP BUSINESS FOR THE BACON WRAPPED HOT DOG STANDS IN SAN FRANCISCO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I absolutely LOVE these bacon wrapped babies!!! They are by far the PERFECT treat after a long nite of shakin' your @$$.  Awesome!!!!!!!!

You can find the cart on Saturday nights from 1:00 am to about 2:30/3:00 am on 8th & Folsom (right outside Icon Ultra Lounge & the Cat Club)  and also on Mission across the street from Medjools.  Not sure where else in the city, but if anyone has any other hot spots, please let me know!!

This past Saturday we could smell them down the street and sniffed our way down the street to find them.  Not my proudest moment, but well damn worth it!!!!!

They are crunchy and golden delicious.  5 hot dogs for $20 or $3 each.... or is it $4?? (thanks Jeremy W.) DROOL heavenly hotdog bliss...

viva la weenie man.
author: Steph M.

description:
Who ever decided to blend two great All-American favorites in a hot dog and Bacon is and probably was the Einstein of food.

I've seen this famed cart many times after stumbling out of Levende on Thursday night and if you see the cart on the sidewalk just a few steps away from the club, you BETTER stop and get your hot dog. 

My first encounter there was just a thought that, "oh this is just a hot dog wrapped in bacon" but after sharing one with my friend, I was mad I did not order my own. The hot dog and the bacon are just great. 

Friends, do not make my mistake the first time you go to the bacon dog cart, do yourself the favor and order yourself your own bacon wrapped hot dog, or else it may be awhile until you come across another encounter with this oasis in the drunken night.
author: Brian D.

description:
For something like this, it's all about the experience.  So take it for what it's worth, I don't think I've ever had one of these without having imbibed alcoholic refreshments beforehand.  With that said, I don't think I've ever experienced a hot dog that's consistently rewarded me and left me satisfied as much as these delectable bacon wrapped treats.

After a good night of drinking in the Mission, this has served as "the cherry on top" of many fun nights of debauchery.  The grilled onions, greasiness, and jalepenos (or grilled peppers depending on which cart you go to) mixes in beautifully with the mustard, mayo, and ketchup.

Oftentimes, the morning after I've had one, I reminisce and can't believe how good that the hot dog was.  I converted an out-of-town buddy of mine (from NY by way of Sacto and LA) this past New Year's Eve, and he said that this was the best hot dog he's ever had.
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
I'm not exactly sure why, but these hot dogs are simply magical. They're so simple yet so exquisite. Maybe it's the perfectly crisp bacon or the butter-grilled onions...

Oddly enough, "Heaven is a Place On Earth" comes to mind whenever I think of this hot dog stand:

"Ooo baby do you know what that's worth?
Ooo, heaven is a place on earth.
They say in heaven, love comes first.
We'll make heaven a place on earth.
Ooo, heaven is a place on earth.
(Ooo, heaven is a place on earth.)"

And no, the song's not by Debbie Gibson. It's by Belinda Carlisle.
author: Victoria D.

description:
Crack.

It's like crack. Literally. And after you've had a few drinks, it's a necessity. 
You can smell it a block away and you start salivating instantly.

The first time I had one, I just asked for a bite from my friends dog, sans bacon, but LOADED with onions....and I didn't want to give it back.
I made sure to buy my own the next time... LOADED with onions.

And if I see him again, I'm buying at least two and rubbing them all over my body.
author: Jenn H.

description:
Hahaha, I usually try to keep my reviews as impartial as possible, but I really have to give this place a five despite the fact that it's probably really a _THREE_ (when sober).

A bacon wrapped hotdog is the epitome of what drunkies want after a night of drinking and partying.  The more you drink, the better these things taste.  I only vaguely remember wanting to cry -- of joy -- after eating one of these in 2-3 bites even though it was (most likely, don't remember this part) burning hot.

The best way to locate the cart is to follow your nose and "stumble-upon" them.
author: Bill T.

description:
does anyone look at what they are eating before they put it in their mouths?

I know its dark and you are drunk and stupid but take a moment to consider how disgusting and immoral this is.

On the other hand drunky will probably be throwing up anyways so at least it won't sit in your colon for weeks.
author: Robert M.

description:
Sweet sweet smell of animal on animal... Always pops up when I need it, walking out of some place late at night.
The aroma is unmistakeable. If you haven't tried it, get 3 just for yourself and save a trip.
author: Jess R.

description:
Avoid the ones by the BART stations

Get the footlong ones!

The guy on Mission by the bankof america on 23rd has the best ones but he packs it in earlier than the other carts.  He's gone as early as 12 or 1 sometimes.
author: BeeryMcGymrat X.

description: Best little midnight snack, soo good that one is not enough.
author: Daniela B.

description:
While I have yet to buy one I have heard the news that these delisious beauties are now available in Northern California.

They have been in Hollywood for years providing me with the but bomb I needed to slam down a few extra bottles of bud after hours.

Bacon wrap man... I am hunting you down.

Hipsters step back.
author: Thadd L.

description:
Last night a street dog saved my life.... Stumbling out of Delirium I smelled that wonderful combination of hot dog, bacon, and grilled onions.
