My bf tried to talk me out of it cause he thought the bacon looked raw. But I knew it was the only thing that could save me from an unpleasant hungover morning, so I was willing to take a chance. 

I asked the vendor "Cuanta cuesta?"  He answered $3 and looked at me like, shut up you stupid gringa. Got the works with ketchup, mustard, mayo, and jalapeos on top. Even though I had to eat half of it in a cab, it was all worth it.
author: Katie M.

description:
I FINALLY found the bacon dog cart. After what felt like years of walking around in the Mission and asking taxi drivers to take us to Valencia because we wanted to find the "hog dogs on the street," I finally came across the delectable treats roasting over a dirty metal cart. Sufficiently drunk enough to enjoy them, I ordered me a $4 foil wrapped piece of tasty goodness ($4? I think they ripped me off). 

It's true, they use regular ball park hot dogs, and kind of wimpy bacon. They truly smell better than they taste. But when you're inebriated at 2 in the AM and smell that lovely scent wafting through the air, you obey. 

Next time I'm buying a Costco polish sausage, apple-wood smoked bacon, a wheat bun, onions, mayo and ketchup, and making one myself. And it will be 10000x better. But I will probably still buy those blasted hot dogs from the bacon dog cart. Darn.
author: Michelle G.

description: i always thought it was a "dirty dog" but bacon dog probably sounds nicer.  It's bacon.. wrapped around a frank.. in a bun.. do i need to elaborate further?
author: Toby C.

description:
As I stumble out of another bar after having a few too many drinks, the only thing on my mind is, "Where the fuck am I, and how am I getting home?" The next thing I'm thinking is, "Jesus Christ I am so fucked up!" Once I get that out of my system I immediately think of where to get some cheap, greasy, artery-clogging, heart attack-inducing, GRUB. I roam the streets, listening for the sizzle and smell of bacon, praying to the late-night binge drinking Gods that they will lead me to the promised land.

Alas, over yonder I see a group of people standing on a corner. My eyes and ears focus on the scene. Sizzle. I get a hard on and make my way towards the corner as if there were a pot of gold there for the taking, except this is better. Basking in all it's glory is quite possibly one of the greatest sights to behold when you're piss drunk, the elusive Bacon Hot Dog Cart.

These guys (and gals!) don't mess around. You have a cart with a flat grilling surface and they bang these out like nobody's business. The formula is pretty simple: you take a hot dog, wrap it in bacon, grill it with some onions and jalapenos, and slap it with ketchup, mustard, and mayonaise. Charge $3 and serve the next one. I buy two every time and make no apologies.

Check out the full review with photos on my blog, see profile.
author: Gene M.

description:
DIRTY DOGS!!!!!!!!!!!  for some reason... i still decline the mayo.  im eating a hotdog wrapped in bacon and i try to save a few calories by skipping the mayo.  

its good. do it.  one time we drove from holycow to icon so we can stuff outselves.  dont go sober though... you'll probably give it 2 stars.
author: Doug ..

description:
My new year's resolution was to eat only happy meat (pasture-raised, free-ranging, wallet-breaking, happy meat) but I've already made an exception for the bacon dog.  

'nuff said.  (but minus one star for making me break my resolution in the first fricking week!)
author: Holly B.

description:
I must respond to Rod's review and his "wtf" on the price of the hot dogs.  You see, these life-saving morsels of delight usually cost $3 but if you are drunk they will charge you $4.  Long story short, Rod, you were drunk.

Honestly, they are so delicious that one time (sorry Elizabeth) I left my friends at a bar because I was so stoked on getting a hot dog outside.  Wow, that is sad. ;)  I usually find the dog cart outside of Brunos or within a few blocks, so 16th sounds about right (Mission district). Make sure to order extra onions.  Anything is better with onions. 

Also, I noticed that some people are ranting about hot dogs being unhealthy.  Well, doy.  But may I add that 20% of the alcohol you consume is digested in the stomach, so by adding some greasy food you can eliminate that 20% from reaching the blood stream.  It's science.   Also, everything in moderation...
author: Carlyna R.

description: 3 dollars. Fuckin' hotdog, fuckin' bacon, fuckin' grilled onions, and any a good selection of condiments. Fuckin' yes. Review, done.
author: Spencer T.

description:
The cops shut all these guys down, and nowadays only the brave ones come out on the sly -- so if you find one, be sure to support him!

We were talking to one guy in Spanish and he told us how the cops were always shaking him down for bribes.
author: Adam Z.

description:
It seems wrong to lump all the bacon-dog carts into one single review.

Oh well, the concept as a whole gets four stars. They're a great alternative to late-night Al Pastor. 

Actually, I think it would be interesting if one of these rolled up in front of Delfina Pizzeria. All those people waiting an hour to get in would probably just cave and buy a dog. Come to think of it, since Delfina Pizzeria actually serves you wine or beer while you wait outside, you could be kickin' it on the sidewalk with a dog and a Peroni. Not bad.

Jalapenos, grilled onions, mustard. Boom.

One for me, and one for that homeless dude...
author: Angelo B.

description:
These little guys hit like a bacon-wrapped stab wound to the small intestine. They are deceptively cheap, as I believe the cart is subsidized by Lipitor. 

Next time it's two in the morning and you feel like sampling an entire de-boned strata of the animal kingdom, just follow the smell of burning flesh.

-1 star for taking several years off my life
author: Mike H.

description:
Oh, man...

I had one about a month ago from the vendor in front of  the Stud, and it was the best hot dog I'd EVER eaten. I'm not exaggerating. However, it also made me VERY sick the next day. I'm talking about nausea, chills, shakes, the works. I was so disapponted that something so delicious could make me feel so awful, and swore to never eat another one.

And then, last weekend, I was bullied into eating another one by a friend who was probably trying assuage her guilt about buying two. And, again, it was delicious. But the best part? No next day nausea! (yess!)

There are a million reasons why nobody should ever eat these things, and most of those are also the reasons you should try them. Do it!
author: Vanessa R.

description:
I love you Bacon Dog Cart. I love you so much that I ate meat for you even though I haven't eaten a hot dog in about 19 years. I love you so much that I am willing to get high cholesterol from you. I love you so much because you fulfill my hunger needs at 11:30PM.

Bacon + Hot Dogs + Jalapenos + $3 = Best Thing Ever!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I have eaten this sober too... and if you love greasy tasty bacon... this is your joint! From the Mission to  SOMA!
I ENDORSE THIS MESSAGE!
 |
 |
 |
 |
 |
 |
 V
author: Calvin T.

description:
Bacon?  great... hot dog?  good...  bacon + hotdog = awesome..

bacon + hotdog + drunk at 2 am = 5 stars!
author: Wilson C.

description:
The bouquet of bacon, onions and hot dogs tickles your nose before you can pinpoint his location. This gent bravely sells his awesome bacon-wrapped hot dogs throughout the night in the Mission, with optional onions and "the works."

Between him and the Tamale Lady, my evening outings never find me hungry.
author: Aida N.

description:
Upon approaching the hotdog cart at 16th and Valencia, I said: 
"I'm Jewish, but I smelled those hotdogs, and I think I saw Jesus."

I mean this wholeheartedly.

(Kudos to the guy on the street beside me, who encouraged me to post this quote as my review on Yelp. You are very wise.)
author: Heather R.

description: Porky goodness... tasty tasty goodness.  Be prepared to be lulled in by the smell of these tasty concoctions from literally blocks away.  Your legs will simply start walking, without any approval from your brain.  But do not resist it, just go with it.
author: Serge S.

description:
Came out of Cat Club last night and there he was... We had never head of such a cart before but... we were RAVENOUS. 

We bought 1. We each took a bite. We went back for 2 more and have NOT been talking about ANYTHING ELSE for the past 12 hours. 

Thank you Bacon Dog Cart, THANK YOU for this life altering experience! I will have you again next Thursday!
author: Amy B.

description:
I crave these when I'm sober.  Does that make me awesome or disgusting??

Whenever I get one, I HAVE to eat it in front of the cart.  It's definitely part of the whole bacon-wrapped-hot-dog experience.  

The part that makes me salivate the most is that first salty crunch you get from the bacon.  Oohh man that makes me feel fuzzy right now.

The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars because $3/dog is a bit much for me.  Sometimes I want two...but I never go there.

Mas jalapenos para mi por favor!
author: Liezl C.

description:
harsh review from that 1 star idiot guy. Wrong location dude, this is the SOMA cart. 

secret tip: put ur arm around the shoulder of the cash collector and say "que paso amigo"...then bust a ...2 for $5 (holding 2 fingers up)
author: boston j.

description:
No food inspector rating:   Check
Low grade meat product wrapped by another low grade meat product:  Check.
A whole of condiments on top: Check
Lots of drunk people lured by strange aroma: Check
Unhealthy alternative to Burritos: Check

Awesomeness of food delivered by unicorns in the form of Mexican Street Vendor!  Check and Check!
author: patrick o.

description: Really delicious hot dog with Bacon.  Bacon + Hot Dog.  Need I say more? The women vendor told me that she just raised the price to $4/Hot Dog as of Thursday.  Don't know if that's true, still great Hot Dogs with BACON! and all the fix-ins.
author: Jim J.

description:
Wow, I am still dreaming about these.  After a really really long night of drinking in the Mission this cart magically appeared and one of my friends nudged me and said,  "hey, look, food, you want one?".  Now, I remember the cart looking kinda gross, and not even really knowing what I was ordering, but I needed food, and once I tasted it, I was in heaven. 

I need to find this guy again!
author: Kelly B.

description:
It looks gloriously bad for you.  And tastes gloriously bad for you.

All I know is that it looks and tastes a hell of a lot better when you're not sober.

Minus one star for some of it falling on my shoe.  I'm blaming the dog for that.  Minus another star because you can't stay drunk forever.
author: Don B.

description:
OK - I didn't order one. I made my own at home, and over a BBQ grill. Good Lord - it's everything you shouldn't eat and I want three of them! If you decide to make your own, don't cheap out on the dogs, and have the bacon close to room temp. They'll adhere to the dog better during the wrapping process. I also sprinkled black pepper on them prior to grilling, but buying the peppered bacon works, too.

I grilled all the accompanying accouterments to make this street food perfect, without the stench of the street and the drunken fool who was sitting on the bar stool next to you moments earlier.
author: Rene D.

description:
Holla. thank you to the fella that kindly handed over his hot dog to me this weekend. 
No matter how I say that it never sounds appropriate.
author: Erin O.

description:
These carts have been sprouting everywhere recently. My first experience of this was in Hollywood in LA and then in SF: Mission, Folsom and Howard. 

I've had it sober and drunk but it is always satisfying when you are hungry and could just follow your nose to a good heart attack in a bun.
author: Katie K.

description:
We didn't have dinner and decided to hit up the Bacon Dog Cart for supper! It was sooooooooooooo good. I guess they have franchaise or branches now since there are at least two in the Folsom area and another on Valencia/Mission and 16th area.
The sausage with ketchup and onions were mmm mmm mmm....
enuff said!
author: Yan M.

description:
Oh. god.  Let me preface by saying that I'm one of those freaky people who doesn't usually eat late at night.  Even if I'm drunk!  I know, weird.  Well, we were out on St. Patricks Day at the very Irish LIttle Baobab.  Bacon Hot Dog man was outside as we went in and yeah, it smelled super good.  Well, inside Little Baobab there's a skylight window thing over the dance floor.  And the smell from Bacon Hot Dog Man's cart was wafting right in.  Torture!!  Of course as soon as we went outside we had to grab one with everything on it and oh, it was so good.  Heart attack on a bun but worth it!  Bacon, grilled onions (cooked in the bacon grease!!), mustard, ketchup, mayo, and jalapenos.  I might have changed my stance on the late night eating thing, if only for you, Bacon Hot Dog man.

(This is kind of alarming, but a friend of ours declared that this had to be the best food SF had to offer (he's British).  Plus he downed two of these things right after another, in about two minutes. )
author: Leslie R.

description:
dear bacon hot dog cart, bacon hot dogs, and the man, and sometimes men, who make and serve them:

THANK YOU. i love you. i never knew a night at delirium could get any better, and then i found you. i will never complain about my life again.
author: Andrea H.

description:
These things only exist because late-night food in San Francisco sucks.  I'd much prefer a good queso filled with guacamole and chips or an awesome stack of pancakes or something equally tasty. 

Other cities: sit-down diner food with your friends and coffee and delicious, tasty food. 

San Francisco: drunk people buying hot dogs from a shady grill covered in aluminum foil and grease, towed behind a pick-up truck, prepared by two people who don't speak a word of English on a shady, disgusting street corner where people have either pissed or vomited all night.

That doesn't mean they're not tasty. At least initially. I always seem to regret it in the morning.
author: Joe K.

description:
I'm down with street food but lines have to be drawn GADDAMMIT!!! In Tijuana Mx. we have these carts all over the place just like the tacos. Mexicans and tourists alike forage from these wheeled weenie dealers and share in an experience that transcends culture,language, and borders, THE HERSHEY SQUIRTS.
 Sure you've had way too much to drink, and yes, you DO need something to soak up that last shot of tequila that made you think it would be a good idea to hit on yer girlfriends BFF right in front of her, but eating one of these would be yet another display of yer horrible decision making. It's SH!TSVILLE from there on out. Yer girlfriend is talkin sh!t  on yer voicemail cuz you hit on her BFF and yer a$$ will be talkin all sorts of sh!t to the toilet bowl. Imagine an oil spill. Got it? O.K. Now Imagine it coming out yer butt. That's what these will do.

PS. while yer at home sprayin down the porcelain, yer girl is about to have a three way (because she's all mad at you n stuff) with her BFF and some hot foreign dude who doesn't eat bacon wrapped hot turds.
author: santiago g.

description: I remember seeing the carts outside the LA clubs years ago,  I'm glad they have sprouted outside the SF clubs,  the perfect snack (folsom street cart) after a night of vodka-tonics, kettle one shots and bottles of heineken.
author: Max L.

description:
SO GOOD, IT MAKES YOU WANNA SLAP YO' MOMMA'!  i mean, SERIOUSLY, what best to go with pork, than MORE PORK?  you just cant go wrong!

thats we kept saying to ourselves as we watched this delicate cuisine being rolled around on the griddle surface... our mouths salivating from lack of sustenance and need of something in our stomachs to sober up from a night on the town... the man preparing our food had ingeniously capitalized on that very street corner - for many were too drunk to go any further than the end of the block... which of course, made the line for these delightful dogs wrap around the block...

ive heard them called as "dirty" dogs... i dont care what theyre made of, just gimmie my food... and it has BACON!

this guy tried to cut in line in front of me and the girls that night, and we threatened to grab one of the HOT hot-dogs on the grill and slap him across the face if he tried anything clever... we all knew that wouldnt be the case though... we'd probably stuff the damned thing in our mouths... and we'd find ourselves using his nicely pressed collar shirt as a napkin afterwards...
author: Sharon T.

description:
Well.. Umm.. I was looking up "Border dogs" to review what I believed bacon wrapped hotdogs were called (source: Rolondo, note: see above).

But, "bacon dog cart" is a fine name, in fact it's just as appealing as these fat dripping, condiment-slathered delights that are sold on 21st and mission past 9pm.

Note: "fat dripping" and "delights" are used in the same sentence and therefore cancel each other out.  I wouldn't eat this again due mostly to the indigestion from fat that I felt the entire next day.

In sum: if you like deep fried snickers, you will like Border dogs.  I don't dare eat a deep fried snickers and I didn't feel good eating a border dog.

The end,
author: Krissy M.

description: Gracias, Gracias!  This guy rocks it!  My friend from Chiapas was talking about these great Hot Dogs down there and then we came across him in the Mission one time but I've been lucky enough to stumble across him on Folsom.  This stuff rocks and is a great preventative choice for hangovers and vegetarianism.
author: Gene X.

description:
Thanks to Yelp, my friend and I found ourselves driving around The Mission on Saturday night looking for the (apparently) legendary Bacon Dog Cart.  We had just arrived in town after twelve hours of driving from Seattle en-route to Arizona so, needless to say, we were exhausted.  As tired as we were, however, we were still craving something as unhealthy, decadent, and morally reprehensible as a bacon-wrapped hot dog.  Such is the life of sinners.

We drove down each numbered street for twenty minutes, eventually (and just barely) spotting our target near 16th and Valencia.  We spent another twenty minutes trying to park, unable to muster up the cajones to park in the middle of the street like everyone else seemed to be doing.  You have to understand that, from our Arizonian-perspective, those lanes are for turning.

Short story long, we added an hour to an already brutally long day just to fill our stomachs with poison and it was worth every bloody second.
author: Robert A.

description: REALLY really good!!!! the bacon was cooked perfect- not too soft and chewy, and not too crispy. The onions are cooked on grill and it picks up good flavor from the bacon and hotdogs mmmm. I dont like hot stuff so I didn't get the jalapeños, the other food didn't pick up any of the hot flavor from the jalapeño. They have all the condiments there too. Perfect street food. I had no idea how great this would be.
author: Kami C.

description:
I remember coming across one of these carts after a night at 1015 Folsom.  My memory of that night is kind of hazy, but I DO recall every delicious bite of that hot dog.  It was the sole saving grace of a night that made me feel like I was trapped in a bad rap video.

In other words, it was SPECTACULAR.
author: Andrea U.

description:
I'm pretty much a vegan now.  I mean, I don't care if you're not.  I'm not one of those types of vegans.  That's the commonest misconception I encounter now that I'm a vegan.  People think you're all like preachy and judgmental and thinking they are bad because they're not a vegan like we are.  But I think there is room for namaste to every kind of people.  Even non-vegans.  (But try telling that to the dying cows ;) )

Anyway I'm pretty much vegan so I may not be qualified to rate.  But you can't say no to the bacon dogs when you've got your buzz on!
author: Brad C.

description:
Dear Bacon Dog Cart man,

I can't get those dogs out of my mind- the sizzle of wonderfully grilled onions, bacon dogs wafts into my dreams- taunting me with promises of sidewalk culinary bliss.  I have tried to forget them, gone cold turkey, changed my walking routes, all to no avail. I am left with one-only one solution.

Will you marry me?
author: Keri B.

description:
I've given in plenty of times.....You stumble out of a bar on Mission Street and the smell hits you....It's so hard to say NO!

I'm always mad at myself the next day (extra fat/calories at 2am is never good) but I've never been sick either....  In fact I've seen my "vegetarian" friends throw their beliefs out the door in the presence of the Bacon Wrapped Dawg......
author: Mike S.

description:
OMNOMNOMNOMNOM........

I have never tasted these sober, but after having a couple (or many) drinks at the Cat Club or pretty much anywhere else, nothing hits the spot like a street dog wrapped in bacon!  Greasy, greasy, nasty goodness.....

P.S.  Don't eat these when you are wearing a white shirt!
author: Yasir S.

description:
OMG, it was awesome.  Of course I remember only a bite or two in my drunken stupor, but I recognize good drunk food when I get it.  A friend bought it for me after dragging me outside a club to get some air.  I remember he bacon taste and thinking to myself, "why the hell is there bacon in my hot dog...and chalked it up to being intoxicated."  

THERE WAS MAYO in my hotdog...I think haha.  I wolfed it down in a couple of bites and I think they were $4?

AWESOME, I will be looking for this stand when I take a break from the clubs again.
author: Patrick C.

description:
Like many of you drunktards, i've passed by and eaten many o bacon dogs.. The dogs are good, and warrant a star all in itself, but I question the service.

One time, I passed by one of these carts with the word 'delicious' embellished on its side. Why not delicioso - I don't know.

Anyways, I kindly asked how many BTU's her cart is carrying, and I got a rudely replied; "$5!" It was early in the night, so I was not interested in the dog, thank you, but I was more interested in how this sucker stays running for hours at a time, on what seems like an endless supply of gas. The cart looks easy and light enough for a 10 y/o Moroccan boy to tow, but those dogs and industrial sized mayo cans must weigh a ton.

I am also a bit sad to say that I've never gotten sick from eating one of these dogs, so I have no ill feelings towards them.. even though I should--given the service of my past experiences.

My friends and I have moved away from the dogs, and now our new addiction is nachos. Stay tuned.
author: Stanley C.

description:
My cardiologist just told me that I have a clot about the size of a bacon-wrapped hotdog in my right coronary artery, and asked if had any explanation.  I told him that I had no idea what he was talking about.

I know the truth however.  So bad, and yet............. soooooo good.
author: Alexander J.

description: Not much can be said about this place. It's hella good but be careful because if you are too excited the burst of hot grease might burn your mouth.
author: Lydia W.

description:
good dogs, but I occasion break my vegan to eat a big peace of meat. Nothing like hot sausage and big thick meat with bread and food on it. But I love bacon wrapped hot dogs rock.

My Fathers New Yorker blood, this is good hot dogs. portable, cheap and easy to eat on the go
author: Leigh McInnis Lee G.

description:
" ... yeah , cadillac margarita  ..."  the door opens and an aroma from the heavens.  I think t myself ... self, i knows you'sa hungry  ,,, but you got friends here and your gf will be mad if you go outside and track down that aroma like a bloodhound.

So, 1hr. later, i head outside and find out it's the hawtdog stand w/ what else, bacon wrapped hawtdoggies waiting for me!  my gf n I had one, then i got 2 more ... damn they were good.  they even had serrano chili peppers, yummers.
author: Sam K.

description:
I found you Bacon Dog Cart!
And I was finally hungry and ready for your oily-bacon-y-sour cream goodness.  But alas.  You were not as good as your Seattle Mexican hot dog counterpart.
Good nonetheless, but once you have perfection nothing else matters.  Maybe if I was coming out of a bar at 2 in the morning this would be a different experience, but at 4p.m. walking down Mission it just didn't pass the test.  Sorry Bacon Dog Cart....but you still are darn good for a lowly hot dog.
author: Sheila Y.

description:
The Bacon Dog Cart smells amazing, especially at twilight on a strangely summery January evening, when you're a just a few drinks in and the night is full of possibility and excitement.

The Bacon Dog tastes okay. It's kind of slippery. The next time the smell piques my appetite I'll take a deep sniff and go find a tamale or something.
author: Eric S.

description:
I love the stand! Even at $4 a dog, it's still worth it. When I eat bacon, my heart hurts! But when it comes to Bacon wrapped hot dogs, it's worth dying for!

Too bad they aren't on Broadway no more. Jealous Restaurants complained about them and they had to move their carts elsewhere. PS: They don't have permits! LOL
author: Dao C.

description: After a funtastic night with friends at Bruno's, I finally got to try the famous "bacon wrapped hot dog" last weekend.. and it was sure damn GOOD! Now, I want more!
author: Heather S.

description:
I burnt my damn lip because on one of these things because it was right off the skillet and the grease was still sizzling.  FUUUUUCKKK that burns!  

The ones in Mexico are better, but at 2:00am you won't notice a damn difference.
author: Larry A.

description:
My girlfriend loves this damn cart.  Even if we have just eaten she'll still want a hot dog. I know I would be killed if I didn't give the cart a 5 star rating.  These are damn good late night dogs, only thing is you have to find the cart.....
PS we are still attempting to replicate the perfect bacon dog on our own and still can't quite do it as well as the cart.
author: Rachel P.

description:
One word to describe the bacon dog experience: transcendental.

Yes, I did have quite a bit to drink beforehand, and that probably made it taste better, but when out for a night of drinking in the mission I can't imagine anything more perfect to eat.

My choice: bacon dog with the grilled onions, ketchup and mayo. If you're into really spicy stuff then add jalapenos.

Basically, I'm just mad that I didn't think of this idea first.
author: Chris B.

description:
I really have mixed feelings about this place. Its a dingy dirty little setup, but man that bacon sure smells good. The dogs, onions, and buns are all so greasy... but man that bacon sure smells good. Who puts MAYO on a hot dog?!? oH MAN that bacon smells good.

I finally succumbed and picked one up and yes, man, it was good. But it didn't taste half as good as it smelt. The hot dog is just hot dog, and the bacon is fatty and not crispy. Its like someone invented the perfect street dish but just couldn't quite pull it off.  

That said, they're STILL providing a much needed service (food to the drunkards in the wee hours of the night) and wrapping stuff in bacon, which in my books is automatic points.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Everytime i go out around the Mission i make myself a promise that no matter what i will not buy one of these. 

Its funny cause inside my head i chuckle at how silly of a thought i am having at the moment. To think that i could resist these things @ 2am as a stumble out of god knows what place on 16th with that drunken hunger to be hit by the wall of smell that comes from these hotdog carts. Luckily i have limited my self to only one of these per occasion as im pretty much broke after hitting the bar.

"Yes! everything on it.
Yuep extra jalepenios, 
More onions, 
Plenty of mayo, oh and ketchup, oh and mustard.
Oh yes be generous since it smells so good."

Until i wake up the next morning and kick myself for yet again relapsing.
author: Alfredo N.

description: There have been countless times where I've gone out with friends and after drinking nothing beats getting a hot dog covered in bacon. It satisfies my cravings and I could die happy with eating one of these because it's super delicious. Only in the mission you'll find these bacon carts right in front of clubs/bars. Haha. Oh, and there super cheap too!
author: Criselle O.

description:
Do you remember in those old looney tunes cartoons when Bugs Bunny would smell a delicious carrot in one of Elmer Fudd's traps and he'd start floating and following the smell in a trancelike state?  Well, that was my buddy and I after barhopping in the Mission on Saturday night and walking back to my car.  

We smelt the aroma from one of these legendary carts across the street from Medjool and it was heaven upon the first bite.  I've been craving these since I had them on the sunset strip in LA years ago and finally they're here!  Now all we need are those pita carts from NYC.
author: Dik Shun K.

description:
There isn't much to say about how amazing the bacon-wrapped hot dogs are that hasn't already been said, so I'm not really going to waste my breath.

All I will say is that one time I went to the Asian Art Museum and ate tofu that made me ill and I had to go home and lay down.  A kind soul brought me a bacon-wrapped hot dog from the cart and even though I still felt sick, I ate it.  Guess what--I instantly felt better!  GOOD even!

So, the moral of my story is that not only are these hot dogs delicious (especially when you're drunk as f*ck), they also have miraculous healing powers.  Is there anything they can't do???
author: Jessi C.

description: Totally hits the spot after a night of drinking and dancing. The lines can get long, but it's worth it. Really, how can you go wrong with fat (bacon) +fat (dog) stuffed in a scrumptious bun and complimented with more fatty goodness (mayo).
author: Lisa H.

description:
There's no way to go wrong with a Mission Dog. They're warm when it's cold. They're wrapped in BACON for God's sake. They're on lovely toasted buns, they put the condiments on for you, and they're only three dollars!! THREE DOLLARS! It's incredible, I say.

Granted, sometimes, if you're at just that stage of drunkenness, you're going to eat one, and then you're going to get home, and things aren't going to be so great. But honestly, when you're drunk enough to eat a bacon-wrapped hot dog from the street, you're drunk enough to accept the consequences. And honestly, they always taste great.
author: Rhiannon C.

description:
I wanted to be the first one to yelp this guy, but god damn him if he didnt touch so many other hearts before me.  This godsent has been there during the good times and the bad times, Hallowee 06, 23rd Birthday, New Years eve/Day The list goes on..... All i know is when that haunting aroma hits your nose, you fall into a trance like state watching...waiting...yearning for that damn dog to cook.... It is good though

*UPDATED REVIEW* 
I believe the Yelping Community should Rally behind this guy and work to get him a Work Visa, a Sponsor, THE FIRST ....YELP SPONSORED ADOPTION WORK VISA GRANT. KEEP THE CART KEEP THE COOK
author: Joe J.

description: I think the Bacon Dog Cart was God's gift- I swear this Bacon dog is the best thing you have ever put in your mouth......this perfect situation of a dog is an angel in disguise. My latest bacon dog was after an evening at Levende- I remember smelling the odor of the dogs cooking, I slighty recall ordering the dog and handing over the best $3.00 I ever spent.  I am pretty sure I ate it, not sure if I chewed the dog but the mustard on my shoes I saw the next morning confirmed the dog and I had become one!
author: Ricquel N.

description: um, what carnivore cannot be tempted at 2am by the smell of hot fried bacon as you stumble home? nuff said. anything tastes good at 2am after a night on the town.
author: Naomi K.

description:
I'll take one...make that two...better make it three.

What better than stepping out of a bar to find that you need not go any further than several more steps to get a delicious hot dog. But wait, this hot dog has bacon on it!  Add cheese and mustard and I have now found my new drunken diet. The only stipulation I would give the Bacon Dog Cart...only when drunk. 

It reminds me of a slogan I saw on a Farmer Johns Bacon package, "Everything is better wrapped in bacon."

This I have found to be true, especially when involving another pork product, not so much with bananas though.

For those of you looking I have successfully found him in front of Laszlos, Little Baobab, and the corner of 23rd and Mission on Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights, not necessarily in that order. Definitely satisfies that late night craving for salty food.
author: Greg A.

description:
It's funny that we paid $4... Haha!

Bacon wrapped hot-dog.  Delicious.  If I didn't have a chorizo taco prior, I would've been able to fully indulge here versus just a bite.  We couldn't find the stand at first and ended up getting tacos... but on the way back to the car, we smelled bacon.

I couldn't help but wonder how much profits the hot dog stand guy makes...   nothing like dirty street meat wrapped in bacon to end your evening.  I can't imagine how much biz the stand gets in the wee hours from drunken folks.
author: Anna L.

description: It was definitely love at first bite!  Bacon Grease... OOOOHHH!!!  They say everything tastes good with bacon on it, but this hot dog cart goes beyond that.  Best thing to eat at 2am in the morning after a night of drinking.  But I find myself craving them even during the day.  Can't get enough of these bacon wrapped hot dogs!!!
author: Kristel D.

description: Bacon dog cart having four and a half stars is proof that yelp is useless!
author: Manny F.

description:
Ran over this on Yelp today, as the #2 rated restaurant for the "best of Yelp." 

After gathering clues today, I set out to have a few drinks around the city, because I wanted a good buzz for this treat. With a good buzz, I checked the Mission, starting out at 24th. No action there on a Friday night, so I knew that my best bet was 16th. Traveled down Mission, keeping my eyes pealed. Saw a few places jumping, but no cart. 

Arrived at 16th & Mission, but no cart there. Knowing that the jumping places where towards the west, started walking up the block. 1st block, no dice. I told myself I would try one more block up. I spot more club action. It's around 10pm and I see this dude across the street, in front of something that looks like a cart. Something tells me, that has to be it. 

Cross the street, to witness a dude chopping onions at 100mph. Spotted the logo on the cart. Same as picture from Yelp. BINGO!!! Found it on the first night. 

Kill some time, waiting for the action to start. Dude finishes with the onions, and starts pulling out the pre-wrapped dogs with bacon. Things start to smell great. I purchase 2 w/ everything for full effect. Mayo on my shirt. Chomp, chomp, chomp. DAMN!!!! Great treat for $3 per dog, and now I am sober. Enough time left to go to another bar, and get another buzz.

p.s. Stated hours Wed. - Sat. 10pm - 2am.

p.s.s. Getting this for the first time is like losing your SF cherry. You haven't truly lived in SF until you had a bacon dog from the cart.

p.s.s.s. As stated by other Yelpers: Oudoor Seating - Yes. More like outdoor standing.

p.s.s.s.s. Good for kids - Yes. Hmmmm with hours from 10pm to 2am?
author: Mike T.

description:
8:45 PM *Heading out to the Mission* "I really am trying to be better about the stuff I put in my body."
1:00 AM and numerous beers and vodka concoctions later. "There's that Bacon Dog Syren calling me to the rocky shores of processed meats and condiments. Yes I want it loaded mayonnaise, onions, ketchup, and mustard. And no I don't care that the bun is sitting on raw bacon as well as the dog. Oh my dear sweet lord this is the best bacon dog I've had. Quit judging me, I can lick the oil and grease off my palms if I want to."
4:06 AM. Wife calling out from the bedroom, "You okay?" Me. "I have bacon dog vomit shooting out my nose. It still smells and tastes like bacon dog?? How is that possible????"
4:34 AM. Wife, "Are you still throwing up?" Me, "No. No, it's moved on to diarrhea."
9:10 AM. "Ugh, it feels like I was held down while a group of marines repeatedly hit me in the abdomen with socks holding bars of soap. Oh and hey more diarrhea." 

Three times I've had Bacon Dogs and two times I've had gastrointestinal problems. Never ever again....
author: Bucky K.

description: My friend Nate and I like to hit a bacon dog cart after a night of drinking in the Mission.  They are so good going down but there are ramifications the next day.....
author: Chris D.

description: These are soooo good when you are super drunk and just walked out of a club/ bar.  I love watching them add more and more heart-attack inducing ingredients (also pronounced DELICIOUS) to the dog while not-so-patiently waiting for mine (or 3).  You can bet that your stomach will probably hurt in the morning, but it's entirely worth every agonizing second.
author: Aaron L.

description: A hot dog.  Wrapped in bacon.  $3.  I don't think I really need to say anything else.
author: Joe C.

description:
so this is the third highest rated food/restaurant on yelp?.......please!.......and double please!

as the name suggests, this is essentially a hot dog wrapped in bacon. throw in some onion and pepper.......and you have one delicious hot dog with just enough smoke and spice to attract all the pit bulls in the area near the mission and 16th bart station. so you are now officially one juicy meat to our four-legged friends.......and they're hungry! run, yelpers! run!

with that said, i'm going to keep it real. bacon dog is a very good dog, especially when you consider the $3 price tag. well, it's actually $4 cuz you should always tip the bacon dog guys. they're working their butts off to feed their families (ok, so i don't know if they really have families, but they look like good family men, whatever that means). nevertheless, i would rather save $4 and go to lower haight. there i can get myself the best sausage in town at rosamunde for $5 ($4 + $1 tip). it goes better with beer (toronado), too.

.
in conclusion, bacon dog guys, you guys are good. really good........just not rosamunde good. nevertheless, i wish you guys much success. may you guys be the next tamale lady.
author: frisco j.

description:
It was a peaceful night in the Mission. I just got off the Bart train at 24th and Mission and was making my way down to 22nd for a little pupusa action at Panchita No. 3 with some fellow Yelpers. So I was just merrily walking down Mission almost at 23rd when this most wonderful aroma started wafting towards my nose...Could it be? Nah...Not on a Tuesday...But...But it smells too good to be true! With the aroma planted deep in my head and stomach, I walk down further on Mission, ever closer to my destination for the night and also towards the most delectable smell at the moment. And then, there it was...A cart with a sizzling sheet pan with bacon wrapped hotdogs...The fabled hangover food of the Mission drunks of the weekend. Also known as weekend drinking with Yelpers. I saunter over to the girl and ask for one. Everything on it. Gave her a 5er and never looked back. I took a bite...Oh dear...Hold me...

I have never had anything like this in my life...EVER! Well, mainly because this is heart clogging stuff. And also because no one has ever thought of serving this as a regular menu item. Take one bite and you get this wonderful mixture of the bacon grease mixed with the hotdog grease mixed with the mustard, ketchup and mayo that's squirted on the top...Sooooo GOOD!!! I mean, it's got BACON wrapped around the hotdog. BACON!!! And we all know bacon goes great on virtually everything!

As I savor the meaty bacony goodness I had in my hands, I continued towards Panchita. I had thoughts of ditching my fellow Yelpers for more bacon dogs. I had the money for it. But, alas, my stomach craves more food and tonight it desired variety. I shall seek you out again, bacon dog girl. I shall see your bacony goodness again...And maybe this time I will add some jalapeos to the mix...SPICY!!!
author: Anthony L.

description:
I had to do it, don't judge me:
1) it was 3PM and I hadn't eaten all day
2) he was right outside my bank at 23rd and Mission
3) the fried onion and bacon smelled amazing
4) wanted to check out Heart and thought it unwise to drink without something in my stomach

It was cheap, the meat was low quality, but it was gone in about a minute. Later I had some gastro-intestinal distress which was really embarrassing, luckily I was home. I'll never do this again.
author: Janet F.

description: Walking in the Mission one night after leaving an art show with some friends that weren't interested in eating or drinking but still wanted to hang out in the Mission, we came across the (in)famous bacon dog cart and I just had to try one.  I got it with everything to be sure to get the full on experience. Although it's seemingly a good deal and bacon around a hot dog sounds intriguingly wonderful, I was severely underwhelmed. I was mildly concerned about how sanitary the storage and preparation of the pork products in question were, but I was more turned off by the poor quality of the hot dog and bacon and how surprisingly unflavorful both were. Perhaps a good idea for grabbing a quick bite late night or before hitting the bars, but definitely overrated.
author: Kristina A.

description:
sausage, bacon, onions, AND mayo!!

...might just be the best part of going out in the mission.
author: Roshni R.

description: Bacon wrapped hot dog. It had onions. It came with foil. It was good. It was outside of Bruno's, but I've heard that it can be found on Mission between 16th and 22nd. Yes, I had it when I was drunk and yes, it was good at the time. I could tell that it wasn't amazing, but I didn't care. Would I eat this normally? Of course! Anyway, if you're there around that time and are in that state of mind, this is a good cheap eat.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
ohhhh yeahh

finally found it!

after getting out of Bruno's i was wayy excited that we stumbled upon it....

i usually don't even love bacon...

fattttness..=(

but so worth it...

gave me a $2 bill in change.......
author: Kelley N.

description: A sinful treat of bacon-y bacon.  The server toasted my bun for a minute, then loaded it up with an oily hotdog link wrapped in bacon, and added on some of those browned onions and ketchup, mustard, and mayo.  Well, the regular hot dog part tasted like a typical hot dog.  But then I'd get these chewy pieces of bacon-y fat in my mouth, which is a real kicker!  Bacon being rather hard to incise, and the bacon strips being rather long and uncut, it's hard to separate the bites to have even chunks of bacon in each bite.  So every now and then I'd get a long chunk of bacon between the choppers.  Definitely worth chewing the fat and savoring it in the mouth.  So be careful not to swallow too fast.  You'll finish it faster than you think, and be thinking about getting another one after you've walked just a block down from the cart.
author: Gerald C.

description: Fast, friendly, cheap and tasty.  The perfect post-midnight snack.  Minus one star because I watched the fixins guy cough into his hand and then go back to dressing dogs.
author: Quinn S.

description: Truly it's the only place where I can receive both a bacon-wrapped hot dog and a marriage proposal from the same person! That guy really knows the way into my heart...
author: Amanda S.

description: There's a whole bunch of these along Mission Street. Basically, they're hot dogs with bacon strips wrapped around them cooked in bacon grease topped with onions, jalapenos, ketchup, mustard, and mayo. Go to the one on Mission & 23rd, right in front of Bank of America. This guy makes em real good, with lots of bacon. Mmmm. Don't go to the lady on 20th, she skimps out on bacon and they're just not as good. $3. Don't eat too many now! I feel like I'm losing 2 weeks of my life with every bacon dog. LOL.
author: M J.

description: The other night I was meeting some friends at Cha Cha Cha, and walked by the Bacon Hot Dog cart. I was super hungry, and almost did a pit stop. The smell itself stopped me in my tracks. It took some serious thinking, but I didn't want to show up late reeking of bacon. I kind of regret not getting one. The perfect greasy late night snack. Cheap, easy, good, and bacon.
author: Al L.

description:
(per my bacon dog cart review)
bacon.  wrapped.  hot dogs.
onions grilled in bacon grease
perfection in bread

This cart is outside of Dalva during the weekend.  mmm... bacon... you can wrap anything in bacon:  fruit, more meat, chocolate, etc, and it would still taste awesome.  Just cause bacon tastes that good.
author: Fong L.

description: Wait, how is a fucking hot dog cart the number ONE rated 'restaurant' on Yelp? Are you fucking kidding me? This rates higher than Gary Danko, The French Laundry and Little Star Pizza? Are you seriously fucking kidding me? They're good and all, but god damn its a hot dog stand.
author: Brandon B.

description:
When you've spent all day drinking at Adam M.'s pool and you roll out to Zeitgeist to start out your night of drinking, one should have a good base of grease in their stomach.  I had not yet coated my innards with the requisite lard lining when I walked out of 16th and Mission BART and encountered the Bacon Hot Dog Cart.  
If flip flops could burn rubber when stopping that is what mine would surely have done when I saw the fabled man grilling hotdogs wrapped in bacon.  Could it be?  I gazed in wide-eyed astonishment while my slack-jawed mouth oozed drool.  IT WAS!!!! The legends are true!  I was going to savor my very FIRST bacon hot dog before getting shit-faced drunk!  
I think this was my last virgin experience.  It was so good.  Pork wrapped in pork, grilled onions, ketchup and mustard.  Grilled in pork fat hot dog bun.  
I am willing to trade sexual favors for a steady supply of these bacon wrapped beauties.  Ladies and Gentlemen...start your engines.
author: Jill D.

description:
Wow I just started using Yelp and I have to say, these restaurant rankings are right on target. The bacon hot-dog cart really is the second-best restaurant in San Francisco. Not quite the culinary nirvana that is first-place winner La Palma Mexicatessen, of course -- but appreciably more exquisite than third-place Gary Danko.

I mean, granted, Gary Danko's wine list may be a little more extensive, its tablecloths a touch more plush, its artisanal cheese cart just a smidge more, um, artisanal. But the true gourmand will note that Danko's pancetta-wrapped frog legs fall just shy of the gustatory gold standard set by those two surly dudes doling out mystery meat from behind the stainless steel cart on 16th Street. 

Still, I can't help but wonder whether there might be a slight shake-up in Yelp's Top Five if a higher percentage of users were SOBER when they wrote their restaurant reviews. Just a thought.
author: Will O.

description:
bacon wrapped hot dogs with grilled onions. need i say more?

Left lovefest when the cold started coming in and was in desperate need of some warmth. started to smell something wonderful and turned the corner....THE BACON DOG CART!! i was so happy because i always have wanted to try one and there was no line!!

I fell in love yesterday.
author: Susanna B.

description: I'm giving him three stars because they used to be cheap back in the days and I'm sure that he's getting all these better reviews because people eat them when they're drunk but I've had them sober and they're just ok. Not hella awesome, just ok. I like that he wraps them in bacon but that doesn't justify the fact that they, like tamale lady's items, are four dollars. I kinda got into it with the hot dog man trying to haggle with him to lower the price, but it seems he has forgotten his humble beginnings when he was just another guy peddling food by Bank of America......
author: EJ S.

description:
Deflowered. I live in the Mission but in the few months I have been here, I have not had the pleasure of having the infamous bacon wrapped hot dog. Espoused as amazing by fellow foodie Christine L., it was a frustrating, long-awaited bookmark that I intended to follow through on a hunger pained drunken evening sometime in the future.
Except I would always forget. Surprise, surprise.
But, Christine L. was sure to not let this experience pass me by--welcome to the finishing touch of my Halloween evening. Despite large populations of Sarah Palins, goblin monsters and disco queens, Christine L. and Carol L. fought through the crowds and at long last I finally had... my mother f-cking Mission midnight hot dog. Foodie virginity, out the window!
No bacon this time, but still filthy, honest and deliciously good. Instant hang-over cure! How can one resist grilled jalapeno peppers, onions, a slathering of mayo on a crispy dog??? I ask you, how!? Nasty as it sounds, it was pure bliss.
Christine L. ... I know you know this but, just had to let you know. Love you!!!
author: Jessica L.

description:
not that my version of heaven is segregated, but...

there's definitely a mexican part of heaven that sends down people like the tamale lady to feed us drunkards late at night.

& then there's definitely a white people part of heaven that sends down people like the bacon dog cart guy to feed us drunkards late at night.

(i mean, hot dogs & bacons are totally white people food, right?!? i wouldn't know, i just assume.) 

in any case, i stalked the mission until i found this shit, & i'll continue stalking the mission just to eat it again. it's fucking delicious.
author: Irene S.

description:
"I honestly remember the first time I came across a small white hot dog cart that would ultimately change the way I look at food. I was with Meemeers, BK, Los and a couple of other people in front of Cat Club on a week night many moons ago.  I remember it clearly but unfortunately I was sober and way too scared to even take a small bite. It all looked so wrong . . . so very very wrong. I mean the thing was screaming heartburn at me and I was not brave enough to take the plunge right then and there.  Plus, BK wanted me to get in the car immediately as he usually does when we are out and about parading thought the dark nights of San Francisco. I didn't really get enough time to evaluate the entire situation and  back in those days I was more of a street cart food vendor virgin who needed more information before making a final decision. I clearly remember watching them all closely as they literally went for there's and after each bite they would all turn to me with big smiles and say, "okay, take a bite." 

It took some time but luckily one very special night about a year later I found myself in front of Cat Club once again and gently took a few steps to the cart. I said hello and introduced myself to the fellows cooking it up and they proceeded to hand me the most amazing meal I have ever had in my life.  I say meal because you get your carbs, protein and veggies all in one lump drenched in mayo, ketchup and mustard. And I gotta hand it to them because to this day I have never had a bad dog at one of the many carts in the city. 

Every time it's perfection!  Time after time I'm satisfied entirely and I even carry a picture of a Hot Dog Cart on my phone so I can look at them all lined up and looking all cute from time to time. Oh, and I have to add that I do not have the ability nor am I strong enough to walk away from the cart. No matter how long the wait or dangerous the situation I'm down for my dog! Fast forward too December 20th 2007 when we were standing outside on 11th and Folsom patiently waiting for our dogs. We heard gun shots in the alley across the way and none of us moved a muscle because .. well.. we had not had our dogs yet.
author: Jazzelyn F.

description:
you know, i should love this, since i am a Bacon Man, but it is a great idea that could have be executed so much better. 

1. not enough bacon. wrap it, sure, but put some in the bun, too.
2. use sausages, not hot dogs. geeze.
3. coat it in corn batter and deep fry it. BACON CORN DOG. every second you don't do it is profit and glory lost.

that last one is a little over the top, i know, but that's how i am when it comes to bacon. really, it's the hot dogs that ruin it, though. even it it was an all beef hebrew national (how's that for irony?) like at costco, it'd be better. but, you know, for the price it is pretty good drunk food. just make sure you have an iron stomach. 3.5 stars.
author: Tom H.

description:
you couldn't pay me enough to eat one of these things sober.  i very rarely eat meat, and when i do, i prefer it to be home-cooked and organic.  i never, ever, ever eat bacon... so how to explain my carnal knowledge of the bacon dog?  well, when you are outside a club and trashed, THE CART SMELLS LIKE HEAVEN.  i don't like onions, which is the strongest smell, and i NEVER eat street food... and yet.  and yet.  i tasted a friend's once, and it was all over for me.  i now guiltily taken part in a torrid affair with the bacon dog cart when i am out late, which is, thankfully, very rarely.  
in true drunken fashion, order it with everything.  doesn't matter if you don't normally eat one (or five) of the extra ingredients.  it's amazing.  probably disugsting in reality, but in a post-dancing, 2 am stupor, there truly isn't anything better.
author: Ariane R.

description: Somewhat embarassingly, and after a full, upscale meal at Bar Tartine, we ambled home straight past (for the first time) the Bacon Dog Cart.  Yay, I said to my seven (sated) friends, here it is.  You haven't had the experience of the Tamale Lady (interruption from girl at cart:  "This is so much better than the Tamale Lady.")  And (she -- meaning moi --continues), here's the Bacon Dog Cart.  We stopped.  A few hesitated (full meal under belt and all).  We succumbed.  It was . . . pretty darn good.  (We all split just one, but it was right after dinner (and dessert), after all.)
author: Laurel B.

description: I guess I didn't have enough alcohol in me because while that bacon wrapped hot dog sizzled away on the hot metal surface I thought to myself what a treat it would be. About two bites into my hot dog the grease had already gotten to me; I ended up going to a nearby bar to get another beer just to wash it down.
author: Sara A.

description: Far and away the best bacon-wrapped hot dog that I can't remember purchasing.
author: Laura B.

description: O dog cart, where art thou? I walked from 17th to 14th and did not see you.  I walked to Duboce and Mission and still I couldn't find you.  I got in the car, drove down Mission to 23rd and still you avoided me.  I love you...where are you?
author: Jenny K.

description: Where art thou my bacon wrapped hotdog??  This is my question at the end of the nite partying in the mission. If a bacon wrapped hotdog was Juliette and I am it's Romeo.  I long for her succulent bacon crispness,  Her perfect buns, grilled hotdog with onions and mayo of course.. Ah yessss TRUE LOVE!!!  Where art thou my bacon wrapped hotdog??
author: Mark J.

description:
o bacon dog man, bacon dog man, where for art thou bacon dog man!?

my friends and i left loft 11 and saw a line at the end of the block. my first thought "after party"?

as one of my friends asked what the deal was, i smelled the bacon wrapped hot dog smothered with ketchup and mustard!

stood in line for 3 mins but inhaled the whole thing in less than 30 seconds...too bad i had to leave the beer at the club.
author: Lola L.

description: Damn. The DEA has been cracking down on all those dangerous drugs? Meth, coke PCP and chocolate have NOTHING on this. Its almost too good- especially after that tiny mission bar you've been sipping your oh so ironic PBR has been pumping in that welcome smell of onions, hot dog and yes, bacon. Vegans are powerless against this- submit to the will of the dog! Damn, is it lunch/dinner/4th meal yet?
author: Tim V.

description: had one last night after work, they were by Double Dutch, on 16th by Guerrero.  i don't eat pork so i asked for one sans bacon and it was completely delicious, especially with a generous helping of grilled onions topped with ketchup and mustard.  definitely will get another one when they swing around again.
author: Megan M.

description: I'd either have Michael Mina's Kobe prepared 3 ways or this as my death row meal.  It seriously ranks up there with San Tung Chicken wings, PPQ crab and garlic noodles or Yank Sing's Shanghai dumplings with things that I crave in SF - or it could be the Grey Goose talking.
author: Dan Y.

description:
one of these days im going to hook up a GPS to this guy so i always know where he is.

get one with the works and grab a few napkins and you will die happy.
author: Britney K.

description: I personally don't like bacon but damn seriously, this shit is soooo good.  This definitely beats going to Denny's. Matter of fact, I just had one about an hour ago lol...I put extra jalapenos! mmmm....I feel like getting another one!
author: Mary-Anne C.

description: Bacon wrapped hot dogs with grilled onions and mustard.  YARMP! YARMP! YARMP!  After a few cuba libres, these little fuckers made me babble incoherently about London and making out...
author: Summer M.

description: Danger dogs, ghetto dogs, downtown dogs... call 'em what you want. You cannot resist the mouth-watering smell. It owns you. And they're delicious. And probably poisonous to your health. But, whatevs... it's a "hit that spot" food.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Found it with my nose once whilst biking, old school styles. Needs neither introduction nor improvement. Pure perfection, totally astral when you're three sheets to the wind.
author: Alee K.

description: It really is good.  Helps soften the hangover, too!  Warning:  Don't try to eat sober.
author: Jack H.

description: I had a hole in my heart. You picked me up to be dusted off, slumped with that stoic face against a recycling bin. You whispered sweet nothings into my beer stained ear, "loving you despite the caustic sex, loving you despite the nauseous breath you bleed onto my fleece-wrapped neck." I had a hole in my heart. You stuck a bacon wrapped hot dog in it and fled.
author: Marc M.

description:
you can only make meat better by wrapping it in meat.

add mayo, mustard, peppers & onions to that & you, my friend, have found yourself eating the (ass)nectar of the gods. 

give thanks & praise.

if you live in LA, a bacon wrapped hot dog vendor on the street corner , in the park or outside a club when youre drunk as heck is practically a way of life...unless youre one of those unadventurous folks who sees meat cooking on a hotplate & cookie sheet & think "gross".

its the best darn dog you will ever eat.
period.
author: Gabby K.

description: Nothing quite like a bacon dog to offset tomorrow's hangover headache with a tummyache. But hey, it's tonight and the feelin's right. I've partaken more times than I'd care to admit. Bacon Dog Men, you sirs are heroes of industry, men of courage and sophistication. You see a demand and you supply it. Your delectable symphonic sizzle is heaven for the drunken ear drum, cloud nine for the taste buds, and three bites from each of Lucifer's heads upon the innocent stomach.
author: Tal K.

description:
Hot dog wrapped in bacon? two words:  PURE GENIUS.  mayo (or mustard if you want, or ketchup if you're a philistine).  and jalapenos.  you're stumbling home from Dovre or Doc's Clock. the heavenly aroma of beef-and-pork by-products wrapped in fried fatty pork, smothered in carmelized onions, and tucked into a not-too-thick, pillowy bun - wafts at you, pulls you in.  Pay the man the $2 or whatever it is (who knows?  they could charge $5 and most us drunk patrons would never know.) GRAB IT.  Stuff it in your maw.  Hot and juicy and goooooood and spicy.  if you live nearby, like i do, you can even take one home - it'll still be good and crisp and hot.  plop into bed, gulp it down - only takes like 3 bites maybe.  go to bed with a smile on your face.  all that alcohol soaked up.  your hair smelling like bacony smoke.  wake up with less of a hangover than you would have had.  and then, the next night maybe?  you're lying in bed and smell something vinegary . . . sniff sniff? what is that??  an errant jalapeno on your pillow!  back to the cart!  

i asked one of the bacon dog cart guys once, so, do the cops bug you for this?  he laughed - of course the cops bug us!  

POWER TO THE PEOPLE, PEOPLE!  
SUPPORT THE INSURRECTION - EAT A BACON DOG!
author: maria a.

description: If I could give it 10 stars I would! I love bacon wrapped dogs, I personally call them Death Dogs!! They are the best, especially after a long night of drinking and dancing. It's sooo delicious! I'm craving for one as I'm writing this review.
author: Michelle L.

description: When I got my fade on, you can wrap bacon around a shoe and I'll eat it...and it'll taste bomb!  Kudos for serving hot dogs.
author: Ezduzit S.

description: If there's anything I remember from those disastrous nights where you wonder how you got home the next morning, it's the hotdogs on 8th and Folsom (near Icon Lounge).  From the bacon-wrapped hotdogs to extra onions with jalapeos, what's there not to love? I'm personally ashamed that my record so far is 3 hotdogs in one night (was not a fun morning...trust me on that).
author: Brian N.

description: When a friend told me to go drinking with him I was a little hesitant. That was until he told me that he wanted to go drinking in the Mission. And you know what that means... F***ING BACON WRAPPED F***ING HOTDOGS!!! I had never had one from here before, and was actually reduced to making my own at home, but I had to taste the original phenomenon for myself. Although the actual hotdog itself is smaller than what the posted pictures represent, it is still a frikkin' good hotdog. I'm not really a heavy drinking club or bar goer, but I'd be willing to become one just because I know this heaven sent tasty goodness is waiting for me after I get my inebriation on.
author: Rommel N.

description: If being fat were still a sign of wealth, I would eat these every day just to fool all the hot women out there into dating my impoverished ass (I work in publishing).  A man can dream, can't he?  A man can dream...
author: Brian C.

description: Well, hello there bacon wrapped hot dog! I couldn't help but notice you winking at me as I walked by. Mmmmm...what is that perfume you're wearing? Why, is that Porkel No. 5? Who is that next to you? Is that Ms. Grilled Onion?? Last time I saw her, she was at Burger Joint and she was 75 cents extra. What's that you say? She's included as part of the package here?? Well, in that case please find your way into my mouth ASAP and bring your friend with you. Oh, also tell Colonel Mustard  and Sam the Safeway Bun to hurry their ass up too.
author: Vinnie E.

description: I could hear it calling me from Delirium. The legend of THE BACON DOG CART! It was like Christmas I couldn't wait to have one.  It was so good I had to get two.  Then at about 5am it hit. I wanted to die. Damn you bacon dog cart! I still love you.
author: Douggers M.

description: This guys is always outside of Levende on Thursday nights. Usually when I stumble out after a few drinks (ok maybe more than a few) this guys is a saviour. I mean like the previous guy said you could wrap bacon around a shoe and I'd probably eat it but good lord wrap it around a hot dog smothered in grilled onions with mayo, mustard and katchup, while drunk around 1 in the morning...heaven I tell you. God knows what it tastes like during the day sober but I guess its all about selling to the correct target consumer.
author: Hyung L.

description:
talk about instant gratification...nothing beats a MEATY HOT DOG WRAPPED IN BACON AND TOPPED WITH ONIONS FOR $3 outside of the club after another night of conspicuous alcohol consumption.

thank good heavens for the bacon dog cart. i don't know where i'd be without it...possibly denny's.
author: Jeremy F.

description: This Cart is my true guilty pleasure, I'm so embarrassed to say that I get food from here.  Its like a scene from some classic drug movie, Me (crack head), so drunk I can barely walk to this hotdog stand (crack dealer) make my purchase, stuff it in my coat then take off running into the night.  It combines my two loves, hot dogs and bacon.  And if I could make it worst I add mad amounts of Mayo and Ketchup.  Ghetto thousand island as friends call it.  It's the perfect after the bar snack.  Make sure you grab napkins at the bar becuase they NEVER seem to have any when im there.
author: Rossi C.

description: OMG!  I didn't know there were reviews for bacon wrapped hot dog stands!  I absolutely love having one of these after a night of dancing and LOTS of liquor!  Give me EVERYTHING and extra jalapenos please!  I haven't had one in a long time but I look forward to having one this weekend...I wonder if it's still $4...
author: Cindy L.

description: The smell is simply overpowering and almost impossible to resist. It's a hot dog, wrapped in bacon, served with grilled onions, mustard, and some kind of mayo. The only downfall is that they tend to make a bunch at once and stack them up in the corner of the grill. However, if you wait in line long enough, you can guarantee some fresh ones...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Shotay and I leave Holy Cow and we are so happy to leave cuz that place sucks cow nuts.  We cross the street and I am lookin around to figure out if we are goin the right direction towards our car.  While we are in the middle of the intersection I spy w/ my big eyes the infamous BACON DOG CART....tun tun tun....   This is the lil cart that has been evading me since I heard about it a while ago and it is finally in my sights.  We quickly turn a 180 and head straight to the hombres tending the pig wrapped dogs.  We are in utter delight.  We order just one as we don't wanna become like crack fiends lookin for another fix.  We look in awe w/ drool dripping...we take turns consuming the protein and carb crack...and in an instant its gone.  We leave wanting more.  But we know we should leave it be....
author: Adrian D.

description: The scene: stumbling out of random mission bar drunk and hungry. the cure: bacon hot dog cart. these tasty little dogs are wrapped in a piece of bacon, with grilled onions and pickled jalapenos on top and slathered in hot sauce, ketchup, mustard and mayo. this may be the best business venture i have ever seen. the one drawback: the next day's hungover cravings for more bacon dog action!
author: Margot K.

description: Okay, so I HAVE been hitting up this cart a bit more often then I would like in the past 10 days...but you know what?  I've done other things in excess before and I feel like these (at the time) delish dogs might be no exception.
author: Catrinel A.

description:
love me the street meat.

drunkenly scarfed bacon-wrapped hot dog: probably the best thing god has ever bestowed upon this green earth.

soberly eaten bacon-wrapped hot dog: probably the worst stomach cramps i have ever had the misfortune to experience.

the guy that sets up on 22nd and mission knows what it is all about---the overly priced and overly visited stands around 16th and valencia are nothing to write home about. i always visit that guy on 22nd and can say that the dog never stood a chance to last longer than the walk to 24th street. i am also impressed with the guy's ability to understand me as i have slurred, "onehotdogjustmustardandonionspleeeeeease...thankyougoodsirr."
author: Kayla K.

description:
when you are wasted
and youve been dancing all night
and gotten turned down by chicks
(or even if you were successful in your endeavours)
and you stumble out onto the brisk san francisco streets

these bacon encased flesh tubes invigorate your SOUL.

HP MAXED OUT

for $3 a hit, you will feel like life IS as wonderful as you want it to be.
everything you regret fades because it all led up to this moment.

CHOMP CHOMP CHOMP get in my belly

edit: dude! just yesterday, a saturday night of unsuccessful girl-scamming, my friend and i decided we would at LEAST end the night with a bacon wrapped hot dog. its usually a celebratory deal, but this time it was a consolatory reward. here's the caveat:

AT 2AM, THE BOUNCERS MAKE THESE GUYS CLOSE SHOP!
cos of the noise complaints from awesome neighborhood folks.
(wtf, what do you expect if you live on a street of bars and clubs??)
so yeah, the hot dug proprietors in front of Delerium usually close up shop at 2am. 

but guess what? my friend and i got the last two that night! 
VICTORIOUS! your damaged ego from a night of rejections from sub standard bar-nacle skanks will be assuaged when you snatch the last two nuggets of heaven in your hands and say:

"The JT giveth, and the good JT, he taketh away."

JT triumphant rar
author: JT X.

description: Hell yes!!  Nothing like a juicy, fattening hot dog after hours of dancing in high heels.  They could be a little bigger, though.
author: Natasha L.

description: This is best hot dog I've ever had, these people are geniuses for setting this up. Don't let them over charge you, depending on how drunk you are and the type of bill you pull out, they will charge you more per hot dog
author: Michael L.

description: There is no greater joy than running into the Bacon Hot Dog Cart at 2AM. This Mission District staple is to San Franciscans what Gray's Papaya is to New Yorkers: the best damn thing you can shove into your mouth after a night of drinking and before puking all over yourself.  For what it is, and for the money, it's awesome.  This isn't exactly a date spot, unless your date is homeless.
author: Chenda N.

description: Dirt cheap and readily available in the mission whenever you need a pork fix. I wouldn't call it good food, but it certainly gets the job done.
author: Lena C.

description:
All dogs do go to heaven!

Im hunting this cart down tommorow!

letcha know how it goes...
author: Cindy D.

description: i have not had these hot dogs sober and i never intend to. the first time i fell in love with this cart was out thursday outside of levende (rip). from there he follwed us around to all the hot spots, holy cow, medjool, brunos, etc. i guess my drinking has gone down significantly bc i have not seen him in a long time. doesnt mean i dont still think about his greasy goodness. depending on how many shots i took early two is just the right number to soak up vast amounts of vodka or hennessy
author: Ashley H.

description:
delicious bacon-wrapped hot dog, i give you four stars. you lose only one star for lacking the following:
- a health code standard
- a designated time and/or place for vending your delicious wares
- getting me sick 2 out of 3 times i consume you

outside of that, this is probably the best invention evar!!1!

(yes, "e-v-a-r")
author: Jeremiah W.

description: Bacon Dog Cart.  ::::::aauuaugghhghgh:::::::  (Homer Simpson-esque drooling sound).
author: Elissa S.

description: I'm sorry... whoever invented these carts is a f'ing genius. I have only had these little heaven filled hot dogs ONCE but that is only because I haven't been out having a boozy old time and seen once SINCE this mind- blowing experience. I was at Impala on Broadway and Kearny, downstairs in the VIP area and when the door opened I thought I was in New York because I smelled grilled onions and peppers. I bolted outside to find a hot dog cart (again, wondering if I was in the Meat-packing district in New York). And then, to my dismay... these weren't just any ordinary hot-dogs they were BACON WRAPPED. AND you can add mayo, grilled onions, grilled peppers, jalapeno's, etc. etc. I pretty much died and went to BoozyFood heaven. If you are a bacon fan, a hot dog fan, or even better... both- next time you see one of these little carts, GET ONE!
author: Sarah A.

description: I thought it was a mirage. Luckily for us the cart was real and the dogs are some of the tastiest ever.
author: Rachel B.

description: It's a hotdog wrapped in bacon and topped with fried onions, peppers and jalapenos. . . .served hot off the grill, on the street, and all you need  to do to get one is give the man those last few crumpled booze- dampened dollar bills in your pocket/purse. . . . really - what's not to love?
author: Valerie D.

description:
omg, i finally found him! i was at Slims on a saturday night  and i was telling my friend about the infamous bacon wrapped hot dog guy. anyway, we were walking to her car (after a night of drinking) and she was like "its the bacon wrapped hot dog guy!" i didnt even notice him cuz i was hella drunk. 
 but yeah...we waited in line for the hotdogs and let me tell you, that shit was HELLA good!  i couldnt get over how delicious it tasted. or maybe i was just drunk and hungry?  but whatever that shit was good! i want another one! i'll be looking for him the next time i'm around that area.
author: B B.

description:
they are there when you need them! after a long night of drinking and dancing, you are sure hungry. of course, you have to gather your group together, figure out who's sober enough to drive and then drive somewhere far to get somethin to eat.

but if you're lucky, here comes the bacon dog cart to save everyone's night! a hot dog, wrapped in bacon, topped with grilled onions, mayo, mustard, ketchup and jalapenos, if you want. sooooooo gooood.
author: Rosalee C.

description: Best hot dogs on earth. *drools. cept they're sorta hard to find for me :(
author: Vivian L.

description: Is this where the Hot Dog Man has gone to??!!  I was wondering....the last 2 x's I was @ 1015 I didn't see him anymore.  =(  And I probably won't be heading there anymore or at least for a long ass time, so now I have an idea....oh and I'll be in the area of Icon for NYE '07, so maybe I'll see him then!!  Hot, greasy, oily, bacon/mayo/ketchup/onions loaded hot dog bun, DRENCHED, YEAH!!
author: Rox M.

description: You and your tempting smell lingers everytime I leave the Cat Club. Greasy street food at its best. Its a dangerous thing to have when you attempt to get home and your stomach starts rumbling and you drive a little faster thinking whether that tasty hot dog/bacon goodness will be worth your next 10 minutes driving home and 5 minutes on the can.
author: Rocky K.

description: Alright everyone, I prefer the name MEXI-DOG! Sounds more mysterious, no? I want to give a shout to the Mexi-dogs not only for their heavenly goodness at 2:30 AM, but because my fiance can pop 3 fully loaded dogs in 30 minutes! Take her there sober and she'll gag; at 2:30 it's a whole 'nother story. Thank goodness I'm fluent in Spanish and can haggle a good price (and they only ask for my $$ once we (I mean she) have our fill). BTW - I agree that the quality can vary, go to the one on 18th and Mission (next to Beauty Bar) and look for a short, sweet Mexican woman. She'll take care of you. Oh - and for those who want to know the origin: Mexico City! Viva Mexico!
author: Cesar C.

description: The first time I had the bacon wrapped hot dog was in L.A. years ago.  Now it's finally in the bay!  Tastes especially good after a night on the town!  I don't care if it's bad for your health, just indulge with moderation!
author: Ren C.

description: bacon + hot dog + 2 am + eaten in 30 seconds = morning regrets.  If you're absolutely wasted, then this hot dog does the trick.  Just know that the dog does not taste nearly as good as it smells.  The bacon dogs outside Staples in LA are better.  I can't believe I'm comparing bacon dogs.  The $4 price is kinda steep.  And I can't figure out if the homeless guy who puts ketchup or mustard on for you is awesome, or is uh.. not awesome.
author: Justin S.

description: Never had anything quite like it. Latenight snacking at it's best, if you're going to feel guilty about something it should be this. I really do appreciate creative endeavors to get my intake of fats and spices at 2AM...thank you for being there!
author: Kim G.

description: I had the pleasure of running into the Bacon Dog Cart twice last Saturday.  First time, walking over to a cocktail party and what a way to start the evening!  I was only 1 drink into the night and I was totally able to taste and smell the whole dog in all its glory.  As I sat in near the ATM and enjoyed my dog, other people walked past me asking, "is the bacon dog cart around the corner?" Oh yeah! Second time, I ran into him was outside of Galaxy or Doc's Clocks and it smelled so good! But I had to resist a 2am  craving- all in moderation.
author: Valarie A.

description: That was the most delicious piece of who knows that I've ever eaten. Too bad I only run into you late nights on the weekends. One day I'll find you in the day time. Other than that, I dig the man, as for the bacon dog cart WOMAN, she did not take her time frying me and my cousin's hot dogs, so we were left with sad cold dogs. Other than that.... EXCELLENT! You will not regret.
author: Ally C.

description: My girlfriend picked up one of these for us and we split it. Much to our disgust the bacon on it was far undercooked. It still proved to be good but I think I may have gotten food sickness from it. I mean all you need to do is cook it for like 2 more minutes and your customers will be fine. If i was drunk I guess it probably wouldn't matter. I'll have to try that sometime.
author: Mark C.

description: Sooo good.  I love bacon and love hot dogs.  Together with onions is just amazing.  I would give the cart 5 stars, but I have never tried eating it sober and my friend Tim says its gross.  I will give it a drunken 4 stars.
author: Christopher D.

description: I love the greasy goodness that these bacon wrapped hot dogs provide! How can you go wrong?!
author: Tony L.

description: I like my pork (or beef)  wrapped in more pork, and then more grease. Bacon dogs!!!!!!!!!
author: Kelly L.

description: You do not have to be drunk before coming here as I am always sober. Extra jalapenos please and take it easy on the mayo.
author: Evan W.

description: No longer a Mission urban legend at our home. Yes, we ran into the Bacon Dog Cart dude early in the evening last night. I had to ask him: "Are you the Bacon Dog dude?" and with a simple, "Si" the mystery was no more. I had one loaded with everything, and it was just the perfect base for a night of Prince at the Orpheum and drinking. It was everything I had dreamed of and more. Ditch the diet and have a Bacon Dog if you can find one.
author: Deborah S.

description: We were leaving the bars to get a slice of pizza and ran into a crowd of people huddling around a hot dog stand near 16th and Valencia.  Omigod ... these things are amazing.  I could have eaten five of these.
author: Ankur P.

description: Bacon Wrapped hot dogs are the reason I go out on thursday nights.
author: John M.

description: 5 stars in anticipation of the tofu-pup wrapped in soy bacon.
author: Maria C.
