description: If this is the same guy around corner from 1015 Folsom you are a saint.  The first bite I took I felt like I was in heaven (with a clogged artery but who cares.. we only live once).  It was so so freaking good.  I was not drunk just wanted some food in my tummy.  I hope I won't be going back to 1015 anytime soon but I definitely will get another hot dog the next time I come back.
author: Allison T.

description:
If you sit long enough at Dalva from Weds-Sat, you'll eventually get slapped in the face with the smell of the bacon dog cart. It seems so perfectly timed... right as you're getting tipsy and you start to contemplate making some poor, alcohol-induced decisions, the bacon dog cart arrives. Consider it your saving grace from some other poor decisions you can make after a few drinks. 

And I might also add, I was tickled to see bacon dog carts in Sayulita, Mexico. They were just as good down there. Mmmm.
author: J K.

description: I swear on a recent night out...this was THE best part of the evening. Not the gallery, not the dj's, not even the free drinks could top the two dogs that I ran blindly onto Mission street to get. I felt like a damn cartoon following the wafting scent coming from across the street. i wish there were more bacon dog carts throughout the city.
author: Parisa M.

description:
well, after a long night of dealing with drunk people there is nothing more satisfying then a hot dog wrapped in the most divine food of the gods.

it is 2:15 AM i have been asking every one for their drinks so i can throw them away before 2AM, which is a much harder then it seems. i am now hungry, tired, smell like fruity drinks that have been spilled on me. i am frustrated and tired of humanity. but the humanities only saving grace i can find is bacon dog cart guy.

now all is good in the world. back into the club with a big happy belly full of goodness. 

seeing that hot girl you have been noticing all night  eating a bacon wrapped dog can be quite hot.
author: Mr. Rivet ..

description: Some nights just don't turn out as you planned. You may find yourself making the long walk home from the bar, alone. Or, you may find that in order to make that long walk home, alone or not, you need some food in your stomach to avoid getting sick.  In either case, the bacon dog cart may be dreamworld of magic that you've been looking for.  Once  the smell of bacon hits your nose,  resistance is futile.  So, just this once, go ahead and get it.  Make sure to get everything on it, and ask them for one of the hot peppers they grill too!  You won't regret it, at least not for a few hours.
author: jeremy f.

description:
mmmmm!

i'm only giving it 4 stars because of how unhealthy it is.  that, and you could eat it in a couple of bites!
author: Kimberly F.

description: I was so excited when I saw the bacon dog cart review on Yelp!  After a night of drinking and dancing, definitely pay a visit to the bacon dog cart at the end the night.  Just the smell of the bacon and the taste of the greasy hot dog when your intoxicated is phenomenal.  Each time I go to the Mission to party, the cart is a definite must to visit.
author: Yun W.

description:
0H G00D G0D THESE H0T D0GS TRANSCENT AWES0MENESS!!  JUST THiNKiNG AB0UT THEM N0W MAKES ME HAVE A DR00LiNG F00DGASM!!

this is THE SHiZZ to have at 2am when you`re drunk out of your mind!  many a thursday night, my friends and i have stumbled out of holy cow to the delicious smells of this cart.  bacon wrapped hotdogs with grilled onions, a toasted bun, and all the fixings [mayo, mustard, ketchup] = HEAVEN!!!

these are THE BEST hotdogs i have EVER tasted!  there isn`t praise enough for how G00D these are!!  

i haven`t been seeing them in front of holy cow lately...WHYYY??  i MiSS Y0U, BAC0N WRAPPED H0TD0GS!!  C0ME BACK T0 MEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!
author: Dee W.

description: What more could I want from a street corner cart? Deliciousness in the form of a bacon wrapped hot dog. Not bad for three bucks. I live for this cart during late nights in the Mission. It only gets a four star rating because the dude didn't give me correct change one time and than pretended he couldn't understand me. Always carry the exact amount of cash for one of these amazing hot dogs.
author: Amanda R.

description: I found this cart at the 16th st bart station.  It was sooo good!  something about a hot dog wrapped in bacon cooked on the street really does it for me
author: Joey R.

description: I could happily devour the bacon dog cart right now.
author: Stormageddon S.

description: The Mexican bacon hot dog stands in the mission are a thing of beauty. I usually start my night off with one at 24th and mission and end up eating one at the first place I see once I roll out of the bars at 2am. For the haters that don't like them these things are the best blend of salt, hot and sweet you ever had. I f you're getting charged four bux for them you must look extremely intoxicated. The most I've ever paid is $3 and the lowest is $2 in the past year. My friend usually gets them for free since she 's cute and speaks fluent spanish. I reccomend everything on them and downing it with a tall boy of Tecate from the nearest liquor store.
author: Steve Q.

description: Once my friends and I went out for a night at Bruno's, but on the way we smelled grilled onions and sizzling bacon and followed our noses to the hot dog cart. So we just stood as a large loitering Asian mob eating hot dogs on the sidewalk. Two of our guys ate 3 or 4 at a time. Then we forgot about Bruno's and went home.
author: S L.

description:
do you know i don't eat bacon or hot dogs normally?
but combined.... omg combined is euphoriccc! it is ridiculous how much i adore you, bacon dog cart. absolutely ridiculous.
author: rachel b.

description: I would have given 5 stars, but my stomach couldn't hold it in after that first delicious greasy bite.  Not the fault of the bacon wrapped hot dog of course.  I think after a night of drinking and dancing... and drinking some more, then being whipped around corners in a Hummer by a mad rushed driver twisting through town in a desperate hunt for the bacon dog cart, my stomach just wouldn't hold up.  My friends lavished over the dogs as I was hunched over the side of the car.  They've always raved about the artery-clogging bacon dogs that are their savior after last call.   Hopefully I'll be in a better condition to eat one on my next encounter with the bacon dog cart.
author: Cindy G.

description: Hot dog, I love you.  You are so delicious.  With your oniony, ketchupy, mayonnaise-y self.  I don't care that you are also wrapped in bacon and will probably give me a heart attack.  Give me two.  Did I mention that I love you?
author: Sumona P.

description:
Well.. Umm.. I was looking up "Border dogs" to review what I believed bacon wrapped hotdogs were called (source: Rolondo, note: see above).

But, "bacon dog cart" is a fine name, in fact it's just as appealing as these fat dripping, condiment-slathered delights that are sold on 21st and mission past 9pm.

Note: "fat dripping" and "delights" are used in the same sentence and therefore cancel each other out.  I wouldn't eat this again due mostly to the indigestion from fat that I felt the entire next day.

In sum: if you like deep fried snickers, you will like Border dogs.  I don't dare eat a deep fried snickers and I didn't feel good eating a border dog.

The end,
author: g l.

description: It's like a fucking Brigadoon.  Get the grilled onions and mustard.
author: Natalie N.

description: this like the best place to when you drunk and need some food to recover, sometime you lucky to see them outside the club when you get out. most of the time i see them near holy cow and 1015, sometime i order up to two cause im so hungry and drunk, haha... the life saver of the nightlife!
author: JessePanda C.

description: The only thing better than a bacon-wrapped hot dog would be a bacon-wrapped Jesus. i am more than happy to throw my hard-earned dollars at these entrepreneurial moguls of pork whenever I see them - even if I have just eaten a nice, full, expensive meal. This has happened. I don't consider eating bacon-wrapped hot dogs "optional" - if I see one, I buy one. I don't even need to be drunk to enjoy these little miracles, I just need to be conscious, and even if I was unconscious, if you put a bacon-wrapped dog next to me, my eyes would roll back like a shark and I would lurch, mouth agape, in the direction of the dog. The bubbling puddle of grease that collects in the middle of the grill really encapsulates the disgusting/delicious divide that the bacon-wrapped dog so deftly straddles with its bacon-wrapped legs. I appreciate how the bacon-wrapped hot dog lords gently spank the buns with their tongs before softly laying the conjoined meats down to rest. I appreciate that. Sometimes I wish I had thought of the bacon-wrapped hot dog first, and sometimes I think I did.
author: Max H.

description: I was gonna give it 5-stars cause it was absoLUTELY delicious going down, but I decided on 4 when it came back up.
author: Zack P.

description: After partying it up in the East Bay at the Elite event, some of the party goers decided to head back to the Mission District.  I initially wasn't planning to go, but it was still early for a Sat nite.   It was the perfect opportune to seek out the infamous Bacon Dog Cart while I was there.  With Keane as my sidekick, we tracked down the MAN.  It was a glorious site and smell to behold.  Let's be frank...when you're a little intoxicated and your last meal was 6hrs ago, just about anything is going to satisfy your hunger.  Bacon wrapped hot dog definitely hits the spot under these conditions.  Grilled on a baking sheet, the tasty treat is covered in grilled onions, ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise, and jalepenos.  Believe the stories...it is delicious.  However, while most reviewers will let their intoxication decide on a 5-star rating, I have to deduct some points.  I know, blasphemy.  Personally, I like my bacon crispy.  I couldn't tell if it was one or two pieces of bacon wrapped around it, but we could barely taste the flavor of the bacon.  The bun was barely warmed up, so it seemed like it lacked cohesiveness with the other grilled ingredients.  It's still a winner in my book, and not something I'd turn down.
author: JeFF T.

description: Seriously people try eating this when you are sober then write a review.  I am fat so I don't mind putting fatty bacon and random crap in my body 24-7.  But after clubbing at the piece of crap temple the bacon dog man was standing down wind to the noobs coming out of the club.  So obviously all the drunk chicks and fattys like me are running to the dog man.  But since I am an expensive date at the bar I was still sober.  The hot dog is an oscar mayer weiner.  Freakin gross.  I'd rather eat a real dog than an oscar mayer.  Dog has real flesh.  The bun was cold and crappy.   The onions were good and the bacon was so so.  I don't get why this thing is so good.  But it must be good when you are so jacked up you can't smell or taste anything.  You probably need to be in the state of can't walk, throwing up next the the bacon dog cart, and wake up the next morning wondering why there is a bacon dog cart cook in your bed.  If you can match these requirements 5 stars!
author: Fatty A.

description: bacon wrapped hot dogs, grilled to perfection with butter grilled onions, and everything on it - mayo, mustard, and jalapeno.  guilty.
author: Haru K.

description: any animal product wrapped in another animal product is fine by me - as long as it is served in a bun.
author: Daniel L.

description:
super cheap, super yummy hot dog at 2AM while drunk. how much better can life get?

Make sure you get all the extras on top including the jalapenos to get the full experience. I usually try to limit myself to 1 a night, but sometimes the smell makes me lose myself to the amazing dogs

A+++++ will eat again
author: lang l.

description: I was wondering around looking for all the mythical carts full of food that people are always yelping, about when I turned a corner and the smell of bacon lured me across the street. At freaking last! I found a cart! And the Bacon Dog Cart at that. Yeah, it's just meat wrapped around more meat but what better way enhance the flavor of a hot dog but by adding another type of processed meat product. Yum!
author: Fresca T.

description: i mean.. i'm a guy. grew up with a brother, gym class, football, making shit outta stuff from dad's shed, shovelin' snow. i am a reular dude and i'll  eat just about anything... but THAT thing is fucking nasty. mabye i'm getting old.... maybe, i've made a lot of mistakes just like a bacon wrapped hot dog; and i'm over it.  i went to college and  i've pissed out of my ass enough times to know what causes it. (mad scientist)  bacon-wraped-hot-dog-off-the-street = baaad morning.
author: Kiyoshi F.

description: you gave me food when I was drunk and that makes you special bc unlike some of other joints I've had been to when I've been in that state of hunger due to alcohol destroying my healthy fitness, you've never given me a stomach ache. or diarherria.
author: Derek Alistair J.

description: if you dont like this stuff you must be a vegetarian or some kind of person who doesnt like delicious.
author: Paul Q.

description: The 80's music was pumping and I knew it was time to go.  I stepped out of the Kat Club and the cold air hit me like a bad dose of meatloaf.  As my friends gather themselves attempt and to leave, an odor of angelic porportions wafts into my immediate area.  What can it be but a hotdog wrapped in bacon and covered in grilled onions.  I quickly dismiss this atrocity as I do not eat pork but my thoughts quickly fade into a melange of gin and cheap whiskey.  As I stand there wondering how I'm getting home a friend puts forth this delicious looking item into my peripheral vision.  The drunk munchies take hold and I engorge myself.  The savory hot dog is tamed by the sweetly caramelized onions, while the ketchup and mayonaise conduct a tasty tap dance in conjunction, complementing thier masters.  One day later I am told I've eaten pork, and if it wasn't for how good it was I would be mad.  Damn those things are good and not even my hatred for pork can keep me from stating that.  Food is good when you've been dancing to Flock of Seagulls all night..   Get over your vegan selves and try one.  I love you
author: Nick L.

description: hells yeah!! you know it!  damn, the mexicans know what's up.  to all you vegans, you're sooooooooo missing out!   if you don't know what street meat is, it's the underdog wrapped in porky pig.  there's nothing i don't like about this, and it doesn't get any better at 2 a.m.
author: regina k.

description:
these mexican enterpreneurs have brought the great tradition of street vendors selling bacon wrapped hotdogs and hamburgers from mexico to the states. 

who says NAFTA results in job losses?  and the best part is, they're good for you!
author: Combi C.

description: I used to save the greasy impulse food for after a night of cardio clubbing, because isn't that what they're there for? But there has been more than one occasion in the past year where we've been lounging around someone's apartment in the east bay and someone spontaneously suggests to the room "BACON DOG." And that's it. We jump in the car and drive over because, honestly, this place is worth it. I mean, I don't even like hotdogs. And I certainly don't like the heartburn I have for the week after our hot dog trips. But man, is it worth it.
author: M Z.

description: what's not to love about bacon and hot dogs?  this is the best thing ever after an evening of drinking.  the cart is somewhat a moving target at times, however.  i have seen it on the corner of 21st and mission, but it is sometimes b/t 22nd and 23rd on mission as well.  just follow the smell of pork grease, and you won't be disappointed!
author: Helen T.

description: finally, i stumbled upon my destiny on the corner of 23rd and mission, on my walk to el farolito.  consider it an appetizer.  it was as amazing as a bacon wrapped hot dog could be and i didn't even get the shits!
author: jess l.

description: WOW. Okay, I agree... unhealthy, cheap hot dog and bun, drenched in reused oil, no food inspection... but CRAP, they taste darn good. I even ate these hot dogs sober (yes, I noticed everyone talking about eating those hot dogs after a drunk night out), during the middle of the day after passing 5 carts while walking down Mission St for several blocks to visit a friend after attending the Carnival festivities... I initially thought, this is extremely unhealthy and is a floodgate for atherosclerosis. But after passing by a few carts, I couldn't deny my craving. They are amazingly good! Yup, they are waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay overpriced, but whoever thought up the idea to bring out hot dog carts sizzling with such an entrancing aroma late at night when all of the Mission is inebriated is just genius. Why give it 2 stars??? Because I know there are healthier alternatives that taste better! I'm addicted b/c of the unhealthy aspect and my craving during such an inebriated state of mind. Besides, my 2 stars will do nothing compared to the hundreds of other 4-5 stars that this "place" is receiving.
author: Ju S.

description:
most people celebrate their 50th, 75th, 100th, or some quarter mark review... my 104th review is near & dear to my heart. what is also, near & oh-so-dear to mi corazon are these dogs.

i don't like pork or any kind. bacon plain has never been on my list of breakfast. hot dogs i hardly ever eat (even at baseball games ... & costco dogs are sausages - big difference, don't make me go there). when i eat one of the carts' delicious dogs i am transported into the land of don quixote (though with images closely resembling lily allen's ldn video). the hot dog cart is like grandma's house with a table filled with thanksgiving dinner, regardless if the cart is actually on the sidewalk/gutter area & you're sitting/leaning against the bus stop/brick wall/one of the few trees planted by newsome's greener city plan. everyone is smiling at you; smiling from the alcohol/drugs/hot random makeout on the dancefloor (i'm not judging... you work it, girl). we're all getting along & have bonded over this meal of goodness, thank god for sane happy inebriates. the line at the club is like the kids table, far away & not worth paying attention to because they don't realize that they'll be in this same spot in a moment's time. whichever way you put it, there's no better & closer meal to have than a bacon wrapped hot dog with grilled fixins, hold the mayo add the rest, after a night out on the town. plus, for the price it's a steal to allow you to step in the land of bliss.
author: Madhu D.

description: Nothing tastes as good as a bacon dog at 2:15am after you've been drinking for seven hours straight and hitting on "hot" chicks who were probably actually guys or 300 pound women but you didn't notice because you were so wasted that even a light poll would look like a maxim model posing half nude on the beach. The bacon dogs also keep your hands full which is invaluable in keeping you from taking out your cell phone and drunk dialing random girls you haven't talked to in two years or worse texting them asking them  to call you up so that they of course can come over to your place to have a threesome with the other girl you drunk dialed because that happens all the time right.  Whoever thought of bacon dogs should be given the Nobel Prize.
author: Hmmm W.

description: a sizzling slightly burnt hot dog wrapped in deliciously fattening salty bacon with onions and jalapenos on a lonely cold night when you need some comfort and love is well worth 4 bucks and walking to the mission for, when you've got the craving!!
author: Jo L.

description: God is great. But then again, so are bacon wrapped hot dogs. I wonder if this franchise expanded to Iraq if all the warring factions wouldn't just lean up against some dilapidated, bullet-ridden building and realize the error of their ways and joyfully play John Lennon's "Imagine"  on their didgeridoos (or whatever instruments they play over there). Oh, wait! I don't think they eat bacon. I guess peace really is just a dream.
author: Honest T.

description: i only pay $3 for my BOD and it's the most delicious $3 i've ever spent.
author: Leann R.

description: they should have these guys EVERYWHERE. outside of every club or bar. who can resist this delicious artery clogger during the early morning hours? DA BEST
author: jeff y.

description: good stuff esp when you have had a few drinks. heart attack from heaven
author: T L.

description: I was bored and reading Yelp reviews about different restaurants in SOMA a few months ago, when I saw something about Bacon Dog Carts!  I had to click on the review.  I had my first "dirty dog" in LA after going to the bars on Sunset one night.  (Bad night, some girl I didn't know threw up on me, but the bacon dog made it better!!).  So, ever since I read those reviews, I decided I really missed those bacon dogs!  I ended up going to a birthday party at Club Icon last friday.  I had just gotten my massive tattoo filled and it was hurting like crazy.  (I had to drive like an old woman, I couldn't even lean back!)  I really did not want to be at the club and was not a happy camper.  So a few hours later, I'm outside with some friends who were smoking.  So I'm sitting there all crabby when I smell....BACON!?  I looked around and saw the bacon dog cart!  Just a few feet away from the entrance to the club!  Hooray!  I bought one and ate that dog with a quickness since I had no time for dinner before the club.  That bacon dog made my day.  Guess what...there was another bacon dog cart just down the street near the corner!  TWO CARTS within a block's radius!
author: Cheryl L.

description: thing is, bacon wrapped hot dogs aka ghetto dogs, have been a staple of hollywood nightlife for decades. i'm just glad to see that the trend finally made it's way up round these parts.
author: Ameer N.

description: I haven't been to this bacon dog cart, so this is more a review of whoever took pictures and put them up.  I wonder if there is a review of the 12 galaxies guy...
author: Jay B.

description: Midnight snackers, unite! This is the place you have been searching for (although they move from time to time, but basically in the same area). A bacon dog is basically bacon wrapped in a hotdog together with some onions, jalapenos, mayo, ketchup and mustard. You're imagining it right now, are you? This is late night snacking at its best although vegetarians would disagree. However, it can be difficult to keep your appetite once you get a whiff of the people around you who are mostly drunk at this time of night. What this place serves, it serves well but don't be expecting too much. After all, this is still a hotdog stand in the middle of the night serving food that you can make in your own kitchen.
author: Alexander L.

description: late night stop. it was great i was looking forward to these dogs. i wasn't even hungry i just couldn't resist.
author: ruben a.

description: damn.... i really want to give it no stars but i guess it's that love hate relationship. i remember one night me and my pal sleepy decided to see how many we could eat. i got 5 he had 6. i thought i was gonna feel it the next day but nothing. then another time after quite a few drinks i had one and it was all bad for the next 2 days.  so i guess it's a little like gambling but instead of losing money you lose everything. fuck it! tonight i think i'm gonna get me one of them danger dogs.
author: Ausewaldoe J.
